story:
About Me

My name is Monica Viola. I am a multi disciplined artist born in Santiago Chile and currently living near Ottawa Canada. I display and sell my work exclusively in my own gallery called MonSky Creations. www.monskycreations.com As an artist, I work in several different mediums. Although clay and glass are my preferred modes of artistic expression at this time, I am also a proficient painter and fabric artist. My ideas & inspiration determine my current method of production to create pieces that are unique and one-of-a-kind. Changing mediums is like opening a new door of fresh, new creative ideas.

“Through my art, I continue to be playful, marrying new ideas and techniques to my artistic growth. My work is not a complete circle, but a joyous evolution of ideas.”

 I have been given a wonderful opportunity and it is a great honor to exhibit my artwork at the 2017 edition of the Florence Biennale in Florence, Italy. Although my artwork can be found all over the world, exhibiting in such a prestigious exhibition, has the potential to open so many doors for me on an truly International level.

My Art

     

  

  

  

Funds Needed

The cost to exhibit in Florence is approximately $7600.

The money raised will be used as follows.

Exhibition Fee for the Florence Biennale   $3500

Airfare to Italy and back from Canada.   $2000

Two weeks hotel & accommodations.    $ 1600

Shipping of artwork to and from Italy from Canada.  $500

 

Perks

As a thank you for your contributions, we have some amazing rewards for you.

$10 CDN + Shipping - MonSky Creations Greeting Card & thank you note.

$30 CDN + Shipping - Set of 8 Greeting Cards & Thank you note.

$50 CDN + Shipping - Artist Signed Matted Print plus an Artist Signed Greeting Card

$60 CDN + Shipping - Crescent Moon Box plus an Artist Signed Greeting Card

$65 CDN + Shipping - Single hand carved Wine Goblet plus an Artist Signed Greeting Card

$120 CDN + Shipping - Pair of hand carved Wine Goblets plus 4 MonSky Creations Greeting Cards

$170 CDN + Shipping - Fused Glass Serving Platter plus an Artist Signed Matted Print and an Artist Signed Greeting Card

$170 CDN + Shipping - Mermaid Bowl plus an Artist Signed Matted Print and an Artist Signed Greeting Card

$240 CDN + Shipping - Set of 4 Wine Goblets plus an Artist Signed Matted Print and 4 Artist Greeting Cards

$350 CDN + Shipping - "Queen of Hearts", Third artwork I will be exhibiting at the Florence Biennale, plus an Artist Signed Matted Print and an Artist Signed Greeting Card

$1100 CDN + Shipping - "Interchange", The second artwork I will be exhibiting at the Florence Biennale, plus 2 Artist Signed Matted Prints and 4 Artist Greeting Cards

$1500 CDN + Shipping - "Fairy on a Swing" , The main artwork I will be exhibiting at the Florence Biennale, plus 2 Artist Signed Matted Prints and 8 Artist Greeting Cards

story:
Pokemon G'Opera

I'm Mike, a college student in LA producing my first ever stage play, Pokemon G'Opera. Pokemon has been a big deal in my life from child to adult hood and after writing an original story based on the Pokemon Go world, I'd like to share it with the world.

Pokemon G'Opera goes up March 22nd and will be for viewing on Youtube shortly after.

All funds will go towards props, costumes, and feeding cast and crew during long rehearsals. March 22nd is right around the corner and there's still plenty of work to be done.

Donations of any kind will be appreciated, no amount is too small. Even sharing the link will be a major help.

Follow @Pokemongopera on ig for updates and behind the scenes of rehearsals and news.

Thank you from the PGO'pera team

story:
Videogametatts origin.

A few years ago I had the idea of sharing photos of my video game tattoos to see what people thought. I also wanted to see what other tattoos people had of their favourite video games and characters. The community of Videogametatts began to grow and I have since had the pleasure of sharing some phenomenal work by artists all over the world. The dedication by artist and client alike has been outstanding. I then became fortunate enough to feature in a magazine article about video game tattoos. Before I thought my ambitions had been filled, a friend said I should create a videogametatts book. I hope you can join me on this journey to publishing a medley of masterpieces by some of the greatest tattoo and art talents on the planet. 

What to expect...

The 144 page hardback book will be divided into numerous sections so that you can quickly search for different subjects. The sections are as follows:

1) Contents
2) Introduction
3) Retro gaming / 8 bit tattoos 
4) Hardware Tattoos (Consoles, controllers & arcade machines)
5) Blackwork 
6) Vibrant colour / watercolour
7) Meet the artists (interview & tattoos)
8) Work from around the world
9) Video game Art & fan made creations (eg custom amiibo, cosplay, String art)
10) Unique tattoo creations - (Gameframe, split, negative, cross stitch)
11) Streetart (graffiti, perler)
12) When Anime Meets Gaming
13) Video Game Music
14) Funding Campaign Tattoos & Credit to Contributors

The funds you have contributed so far and yet to contribute will help towards designing, printing, publication, marketing and distribution of the book as well as providing funds to build an ecommerce website for better business use and organisation. 

Any gamer would be proud to show off their custom piece tattooed exclusively for the book by one of many artists offering their skills as a one time perk so make sure you don't miss out!

Thank you all again for joining me on this journey and taking your time to read my story.

If you wish to select a perk, all.major currencies are accepted!

story:
Apoteka is a space for contemporary art opened in 2013 in the old town center of Vodnjan, in the space of an abandoned pharmacy. Vodnjan is a small town located in the southwestern part of the Istrian peninsula, which with its specific landscape and architecture builds interest of  growing number of visitors.


Apoteka is formed as a project room, as a place of realization of programs of different format, open to various artistic media, positions and practices, and a series of temporary content of variable nature, a place of meeting and discussions, open ground of artistic, curatorial, programs research.

The program is focused on research, promotion, understanding and presentation of contemporary art practices, as "generator" of new contents, formed as a mosaic of different presentation formats, and a long-term flexible concept.

Since it was established at Apoteka were exhibited recent, young Croatian and foreign artists whose works have been recognized in international context.

Why we need your help?

Conditions of the space in which Apoteka operates today were very bad, and it took us two years of work and investment in order to create minimum conditions for action. Since Apoteka is located at the old and abandoned pharmacy we tried to largely preserve the authenticity of the space and the existing furniture. Due to the preservation and maintenance we need your help. It would provide dehumidifiers of the space that we desperately need to prevent the presence of humidity and prevent the harmful effects to the space and the exhibits, as well as artworks that are present during the program.

Apoteka is a non-profit organization and our resources are not sufficient to complete the realization of our vision and idea to bring contemporary art closer to to the local community and visitors with an emphasis on supporting young artists, education, dialogue, interaction and discursive practice environment.


The resources Apoteka receives are not sufficient for sole exhibition and after 3 years, program is realized with enthusiasm and underpaid work of all involved, and good will to host artists and their families in our own homes.

In three years we have realized 11 exhibitions, supported 15 artists, participated in 3 international fairs, and hosted hundreds of people at our opening events.

What will we do with your money?

We'll buy two space dehumidifiers, so Apoteka can breath.

We'll buy a projector, so we do not have to ask those who have more than us.

We will do more great exhibitions during the winter, so our local community wouldn’t hibernate after the tourist season.

We would like this little town to become "Piccolo Parigi"!



Apotekaje prostor za suvremenu umjetnost otvoren 2013 u staroj gradskoj jezgri Vodnjana, u prostoru napuštene apoteke. Vodnjan je mali grad smješten na jugozapadnom dijelu istarskog poluotoka, a sa svojim specifičnim pejzažima i arhitekturom zanimljiv je sve većem broju posjetitelja.


Apoteka je koncipirana kao project room u koji predstavlja mjesto realizacije programa različitog formata, otvorenog za različite umjetničke medije, pozicije i prakse te nizom privremenih sadržaja promjenjiva karaktera, mjesto susreta i razgovora, otvoreni poligon umjetničkog, kustoskog, programskog istraživanja .

Program je usmjeren ka istraživanju, promoviranju, razumijevanju i prezentaciji suvremenih umjetničkih praksi kao “generator” novih sadržaja, formiran kao mozaik različitih prezentacijskih formata, a predstavlja dugoročan fleksibilan koncept.

Od pokretanja do danas u Apoteci su izlagali recentni, mladi hrvatski i strani umjetnici koji su svojim radovima prepoznati i u međunarodnom kontekstu.


Zašto trebamo vašu pomoć?

Stanje prostora u kojem danas djeluje Apoteka bilo je u ruševnom stanju te nam je trebalo  dvije godine rada i ulaganja kako bi se stvorili minimalni uvjeti za djelovanje. S obzirom da je Apoteka smještena u prostoru stare i napuštene ljekarne pokušali smo u velikoj mjeri sačuvati autentičnost samog prostora i postojećeg namještaja. Zbog očuvanja i održavanja potrebna nam je i vaša pomoć. Njome bi osigurali odvlaživače prostora koji su nam prijeko potrebni da spriječimo prisutnost vlage i onemogućimo štetno djelovanje kako na prostor tako i na eksponate i umjetnička djela koja su tijekom odvijanja programa prisutni u prostoru.

Apoteka je neprofitna organizacija te nam sredstva kojima raspolažemo nisu dovoljna da u potpunosti realiziramo našu viziju i ideju da lokalnoj zajednici i posjetiteljima približimo suvremenu umjetnost stavljajući naglasak na potporu mladim umjetnicima, edukacije, dijaloge, interakciju i diskurzivne prakse okoline.

Sredstva koja Apoteka dobije nistu dostatna za jednu standardnu izložbu, te se program i nakon 3 godine realizira entuzijazmom i potplaćenim radom svih uključenih I dobrom voljom da ugostimo umjetnike i njihove obitelji u svojim domovima.

U 3 godine realizirali smo 11 izložbi, podržali 15 umjetnika, sudjelovali na 3 međunarodna sajma te na svojim otvaranjima ugostili više stotina ljudi.



Što ćemo napraviti s vašim novcima?

Kupit ćemo dva odvlaživača prostora kako bi nam Apoteka prodisala.

Kupit ćemo projektor da ne moramo moliti one koji imaju vise od nas.

Raditi ćemo super izložbe i tijekom zime da nam lokalna zajednica ne hibernira nakon turističke sezone.

Da ovaj lijepi grad postane “Piccolo Parigi”!

Apotekaje prostor za suvremenu umjetnost otvoren 2013 u staroj gradskoj
jezgri Vodnjana, u prostoru napuštene apoteke. Vodnjan je mali grad smješten na
jugozapadnom dijelu istarskog poluotoka, a sa svojim specifičnim pejzažima i
arhitekturom zanimljiv je sve većem broju posjetitelja. 
Apoteka je
koncipirana kao project room u koji predstavlja mjesto realizacije programa
različitog formata, otvorenog za različite umjetničke medije, pozicije i prakse
te nizom privremenih sadržaja promjenjiva karaktera, mjesto susreta i
razgovora, otvoreni poligon umjetničkog, kustoskog, programskog istraživanja .
Program je
usmjeren ka istraživanju, promoviranju, razumijevanju i prezentaciji suvremenih
umjetničkih praksi kao “generator” novih sadržaja, formiran kao mozaik
različitih prezentacijskih formata, a predstavlja dugoročan fleksibilan
koncept.
Od
pokretanja do danas u Apoteci su izlagali recentni, mladi hrvatski i strani
umjetnici koji su svojim radovima prepoznati i u međunarodnom kontekstu.
Zašto
trebamo vašu pomoć?
Stanje
prostora u kojem danas djeluje Apoteka bilo je u ruševnom stanju te nam je
trebalo  dvije godine rada i ulaganja
kako bi se stvorili minimalni uvjeti za djelovanje. S obzirom da je Apoteka
smještena u prostoru stare i napuštene ljekarne pokušali smo u velikoj mjeri
sačuvati autentičnost samog prostora i postojećeg namještaja. Zbog očuvanja i
održavanja potrebna nam je i vaša pomoć. Njome bi osigurali odvlaživače
prostora koji su nam prijeko potrebni da spriječimo prisutnost vlage i onemogućimo
štetno djelovanje kako na prostor tako i na eksponate i umjetnička djela koja
su tijekom odvijanja programa prisutni u prostoru.
Apoteka je
neprofitna organizacija te nam sredstva kojima raspolažemo nisu dovoljna da u
potpunosti realiziramo našu viziju i ideju da lokalnoj zajednici i
posjetiteljima približimo suvremenu umjetnost stavljajući naglasak na potporu
mladim umjetnicima, edukacije, dijaloge, interakciju i diskurzivne prakse
okoline.
Sredstva koja Apoteka dobije nistu dostatna za jednu standardnu
izložbu, te se program i nakon 3 godine realizira entuzijazmom i potplaćenim
radom svih uključenih I dobrom voljom da ugostimo umjetnike i njihove obitelji
u svojim domovima.
U 3 godine
realizirali smo 11 izložbi, podržali 15 umjetnika, sudjelovali na 3 međunarodna
sajma te na svojim otvaranjima ugostili više stotina ljudi.
Što ćemo napraviti s vašim novcima?
Kupit ćemo dva odvlaživača prostora kako bi nam Apoteka
prodisala.
Kupit ćemo projektor da ne moramo moliti one koji imaju vise od
nas.
Raditi ćemo super izložbe i tijekom zime da nam lokalna
zajednica ne hibernira nakon turističke sezone.
Da ovaj lijepi grad postane “Piccolo Parigi”!

story:
Hi, I'm Alejandra and I'm a graphic artist, I do urban art and portraits and I get by as a graphic designer, currently in need of updating some of my equipment, which I rely on to make a living, I would very much appreciate your help, it would make a huge positive impact in my life and career, your kind contribution would represent a much needed and appreciated lift and once back on my feet I'd be sure to keep this wave of kindness going by helping others in need. Feel free to take a look at my artwork, I left a link to my portfolio down below.

 

Thank you for taking the time to read my little plea, and for your kind contributions, sending much love and good vibes out to the world, peace, 

 

Alejandra

 

http://arrambidealejandra.wix.com/artistportfolio

story:
PROJECT SUMMARY

As our primary information source, our discovery of the world often starts with the screen, and it is beginning to affect the way that we think and behave.

My name is Gabriella and I’m an independent curator based in Liverpool, with a passion to uncover the neurological issues that are currently being raised as a result of our engagement with digital technology. After three years of research, I am in collaboration with a number of neuroscientists, psychologists and artists, who like me feel strongly, that this is a highly relevant topic for a society driven by smartphones and digital culture.

I have raised 80% of my funds through Arts Council England, and need to raise the final 20% to bring this event to the public.

 

WHAT AM I PROPOSING TO DO?

This campaign will support the commissioning of a new artwork, and production of the immersive event, ‘Cognitive Conversations’, featuring artistic performances and a panel discussion. The event will take place at FACT (Foundation for Art and Creative Technology) in Liverpool, and will analyse the neurological effects of digital technology, and its impact on the experience of art. 

Leading the activity are a group of fantastic people, including a neuroscientist, curator, designer and two artists, who each consider the relationship between humans and technology within their practice.

Audience participation will be a predominant feature, leading the event in its analysis of how humans are evolving to engage with objects and technology in the digital age. In the newly commissioned artwork, ‘A Semantic Survey of Forms’, artist Marcos Lutyens and neuroscientist Richard Cytowic will invite audience members to interact with unknown objects, entering a psychological experience exploring perception and sensory experience. Zara Worth will appear before her audience through an Augmented Reality experience, questioning the importance of the artist’s presence in performance art practice.

 

WHAT WILL THIS ACHIEVE?

This is not a money making project. It is a chance to bring five minds together, and create an event and experience that will engage its audience with the extremely relevant issues of the digital age.

Primarily, I am keen to develop a further exhibition exploring the issues discussed within the programme, so the event will function as a research tool that will inform this future work. 

 

WHAT WE NEED.

Having already raised £6500 through the Arts Council, we need £2000 more to achieve our goals!

Together, this money will help us achieve:

. Commission a new artwork by Marcos Lutyens & Richard Cytowic.

. Travel costs for Marcos Lutyens & Richard Cytowic to come all the way from the States to Liverpool!

. Speaker fees including travel & accommodation.

. Production fees for the ‘Cognitive Conversations’ event.

Any extra income achieved past our goal, will create a longer lifeline for the research we have uncovered through a publication or exhibition.

 

WHO IS INVOLVED?

Richard E. Cytowic - Professor of Neurology, George Washington University
Forty years ago neurologist Cytowic rediscovered the crossed senses of synesthesia and returned it to mainstream science. It is now recognised as a fundamental issue involved in the brain’s perception. Cytowic’s upcoming book investigates the role of mediated images and technology in young people, with a focus on attention and addiction.

Marcos Lutyens - Artist
Lutyens’s artistic practice is centred on his audience’s embodied experience of art. These engagements investigate different forms of consciousness, drawing on the psychological process one experiences through the various scenarios and conditions underlying his artworks. His past projects often draw from our external surroundings, social media dialogue and biological communication.

Zara Worth - Artist
Concerned with our relationship with hand-held technology and social media, Worth’s practice utilises online culture and technology as a subject and medium for artworks with on- and offline lives. Her recent research and performance for the event explores the importance of presence in performance art practice. What are the possibilities and meanings of ‘presence’ and being ‘present’ in light of audiovisual technologies?

Professor Karen Cham - Digital Transformation Design Expert
Cham’s core expertise lies in designing for PET (persuasion, emotion & trust) in the user experience for digital transformation and behaviour change. Her research leads our current technological progression in the convergence of algorithms, personal data and affective computing. She strives to close the semantic gap between users and machines, using design and visual communication as a neuro-transformative tool, to nudge our emotional and cognitive responses.

Gabriella Warren-Smith - Curator
Warren-Smith is a Liverpool based independent curator, whose research investigates the impact of digital culture on human behaviour. She is the originator of ‘Cognitive Sensations’, which has emerged through her research and collaborative activity exploring the neurological effects of the digital age. With a background in architecture, Warren-Smith is particularly interested in the psychological impact of our physical environment, and its relationship with our increasing engagement within the virtual realm.

story:
All Donations are 100% Tax Deductible

Founded in 2009, Green Art People is a non profit organization in Ventura, CA.  Our mission is to inspire and nurture our under-served community through art, music, and conservation.  We provide a facility and several programs that put the power to create in the hands of our community.  

Be part of the Magic and get the warm feelings and satisfaction you receive when you give from the heart to a non profit organization that inspires and enriches lives on the Westside of Ventura, in a really rough part of town.

 

      All of your donations are 100% tax deductible. We are grateful to the      Downtown Ventura Association for acting as our fiscal reciever for this project.
      

What we will do with the funding?

* Operating expenses:  Rent, insurance, permits, parking, utilities, Maintenance 
* Continuing our current programs, expand our current children's programs
* Roll out our exciting After School Teen Performance/Dream Mentoring Program.
* MOST OF ALL: Significant funding will allow us much needed breathing room to write more grants that will help sustain Green Art People for the long haul.
*None of this funding will go toward salaries for staff. For 6 years, our organization has been 100% volunteer driven. We do it because this community is remarkable & deserves an accessible space where we can get inspired collaborate, connect, create, conserve together.  ALL AGES, (Ages 3-93,) EVERYONE DESERVES GAP!

  Why does having a "Creative Community" matter?
In our always on, always connected, world of screens, social media and on demand everything; the "Modern-Day Arts Based Community Development Movement" has proven art and music are a powerful alternative to connect community and promote positive changes in our neighborhoods.  


Please, learn more about our programs and community! Click on these slideshows and videos 

Our programs include: 

Growing Art People:  Our children’s program teaches children to use their voices! We focus on being creative & learning to conserve the environment through art, storytelling, guitar and banjo lessons, drumming and other rotating workshops & classes.  A portion of our funding will go toward expanding this program and developing a new exciting & innovative Teen performance program. Click on the Children's Video BELOW to learn more,

  


Wednesday Night Short Attention Span Theater:  Community gathering that connects people through art and music and conservation.  Our community art corner is stocked with paint and themed murals that everyone can be a part of.



Local Archiving Music Project: Recording and Preserving the history of local music and creating an archive that can be accessed by the public.


The UpCycle Art Supply Store:  Donated and Recycled art materials are given free to teachers in our public school system and low cost art materials to artists.  In turn, keeping thousands of pounds of useful art and craft materials out of our landfills   

                              



 Green Action Team:  Connecting Eco minded individuals & Organizations that enact positive change through environmental preservation based activities.


                                                   Our Story

Founded Green Art People in 2009.  We had a classic grassroots start. Every week our programs grew and we were inspired by how many people found healing, camaraderie and inspiration from Green Art People and its mission.  At one point, we even had to close our doors for unexpected construction, we didn't have a dime left to do it.  Our local community helped raise the much needed funding and donated countless hours upgrading our building, adding ramps, and extra doors for safety. We persevered through 14 months of City  requirements and with a lot of help from our friends and families, we reopened 4 years ago and have been growing ever since.

           

The diversity and support of our community touches us to no end.  

We are truly an all age venue, People from the age of 3-93 have enjoyed Green Art People and all of our programs.  In our first 6 years, we have produced 250 free live music events, archived over 900 hours of local music, collaborated with 25 plus local organizations, and reached over 65,000 people with our programs, collaborations and mission. Not to mention we grew a global audience that tunes into our productions, live streamed every Wednesday night.  ALL OF IT HAS BEEN  100% VOLUNTEER DRIVEN  


Last year, Green Art People contributed 10,500 volunteer hours toward creativity and conservation in Ventura. We partnered with dozens of like minded organizations and loved every minute of it.  It’s the love and talent in this community that keeps us going!  We just can't imagine Ventura without it. 

           

Use Your Voice!

 Write a testimony and share it along with with our campaign link.  If, at some point in your life, Green Art People has been there for you or inspired you,  Please share your story on Social media and include our campaign link and remind them to click on it!     www.indiegogo.com/projects/green-art-people

story:
This campaign has ended - but phase 2 is up and running - It is not too late to make a donation! - https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/textile-residency-in-india-phase-2/x/141278#/

 

Textiles Are A Universal Language! Textiles Cross Barriers! Textiles Keep Tradition Alive!

This fall I have an opportunity to return to India, where I will be participating in a 2 month residency - D.I.S.C. the Art Textile Program “LINK. The never ending thread”.  The trip will take place October and November of 2017 in the state of Odisha. The participants will include both international and Indian textile artists. I hope I can count on your support!

In the state of Odisha thousands of weavers inhabit remote villages living with age old traditions, creating beautiful textiles in cotton and silk. Each region has a distinct style, most well known are the ikat fabrics produced for saris, bed covers and table linens. 

During this textile program we will travel together to rural villages meeting the master artisans who produce the backbone of traditional Odian art – textiles. This journey is about art, people, how art connects us, it is about experiencing the joy of simple living and about stepping out of our comfort zone. It is about expressing ideas through textile techniques, materials and concepts. It is all about sharing and collaboration!

"During the introductory journey to the traditional Odian textile artists will visit five places known for the traditional textile. Artists will stay three – four days at each place to gain more knowledge and understanding about the particular form of textile, and meet the masters. Also artists will see the life cycle of textile. Not only this, they may enjoy the simple way of living in rural Odisha, to enjoy the life style of the textile masters and share some time together. After 25 days of textile journey artists will move to the base camp of the residency where they will work on their concepts for five days. When the concepts will be ready and finalized artists could start working on the particular bodies of art work. At the very end of the program the exhibition of the creative collaboration will be organized at Bhubaneswar. " (D.I.S.C. The Art)

I have also been invited return to the Aranya Natural Dye Unit in Munnar Kerala (Southern India) once again. Here I will have not only the opportunity to say hello and see how everyone is doing  - to hear their laughter and give them big hugs, but also to share with them new ideas, concepts and techniques!

To return to India to share and learn has long been a dream of mine and you can help to make it happen.

I am looking to raise $7000.00 to cover the residency expenses and airfare.  A portion of the money will cover my visa, travel insurance, travel doctor and a supply of Malaria medicine. The money will also cover my expenses for my extra week in Munnar where I will be volunteering at Aranya.

I have produced three photo books celebrating the people I have worked with (Stories of Hope - Mexico, India & Rwanda, Stories of Hope - Oaxaca, Weavers of Southern Mexico and the third, Stories of Hope - India) .

As part of my residency I will produce a fourth book documenting the amazing people I will be meeting and working with.  It will tell the story of the age-old textiles and the struggle to continue working with handlooms as India modernizes its weaving industry by introducing powerlooms. This new book celebrating creative positivity will be one of the perks!

Over the past several years I have been able to travel and teach in so many parts of the world, India, Rwanda, Mexico, Turkmenistan, Kazakhstan, in Italy - with middle-schoolers on a US Military base whose parents were stationed in Afghanistan and with NYC 6th graders through the Silk Road Connect Project. I look forward to continuing this tradition of sharing, learning and teaching.  Many of these projects happened because of generous people like you!

Watch this video of the Silk Road Connect in NYC

If you cannot make a contribution but you really want to help, you can share this project on Facebook and Twitter! You can also tell your friends and family how they can be part of this rewarding experience by inviting them to visit the project on  www.madderlane.com or here on Indiegogo!

Also, have you tried the Indiegogo sharing tools? They are easy to use and also very effective!

Thank you very much!

Together we can make a difference!

Linda

The money will also cover my expenses for my extra week in Munnar where I will be volunteering at Aranya.I have produced three photo books celebrating the people I have worked with (Stories of Hope - Mexico, India & Rwanda, Stories of Hope - Oaxaca, Weavers of Southern Mexico and the third, Stories of Hope - India) .As part of my residency I will produce a fourth book documenting the amazing people I will be meeting and working with.  It will tell the story of the age-old textiles and the struggle to continue working with handlooms as India modernizes its weaving industry by introducing powerlooms. This new book celebrating creative positivity will be one of the perks!Over the past several years I have been able to travel and teach in so many parts of the world, India, Rwanda, Mexico, Turkmenistan, Kazakhstan, in Italy - with middle-schoolers on a US Military base whose parents were stationed in Afghanistan and with NYC 6th graders through the Silk Road Connect Project. I look forward to continuing this tradition of sharing, learning and teaching.  Many of these projects happened because of generous people like you!Watch this video of the Silk Road Connect in NYCIf you cannot make a contribution but you really want to help, you can share this project on Facebook and Twitter! You can also tell your friends and family how they can be part of this rewarding experience by inviting them to visit the project on  www.madderlane.com or here on Indiegogo!Also, have you tried the Indiegogo sharing tools? They are easy to use and also very effective!Thank you very much!Together we can make a difference!Linda

story:
About me and my Fundraiser!

Hello, my name is Desirae. I have been a crafter since I can remember. I have always donated my hand made wares to others and charitable groups as I have often made more items than I could personally use. Since November 2014, I have been unemployed. Having applied to many jobs and having no luck, I have decided to bring my passion of color and ceramics to others and start my own business as a means to support my family. I have made 3 sales so far in the last two weeks, but I'm not able to produce the inventory I need to be successful fast enough or at a cost that is profitable because I do not have my own kiln.  I also would love to share my craft with others through lessons and donate my services to schools in my local area by hosting free ceramic classes to those that can not afford to learn about this wonderful art form, and eventually open my own studio.  At this time I am driving 20 minutes away and paying someone else to fire my pieces. This has reduced my profit to pennies on the dollar.


Please feel free to visit my shop on Etsy @ http://www.etsy.com/shop/DabaDos

I have been working very hard on marketing and designing a logo. I receive $168.00 a week from unemployment and I have only a few dollars each week to put towards this venture. I know that I can be successful with your help and in return I am offering custom pieces to say thank you.

What I Need & What You Get

What I need:

A new kiln cost $2343.00 w/o tax. The stilts and posts that I would need to operate the kiln cost around $300.00 and the estimate for an electrician to install it is $300.00. Total cost $3000.00 - all the money I receive will go towards this. If I do not reach my goal then any funds I receive will be split 50% towards glaze and inventory to make more pieces and 50% saved for a kiln. So either way all funds will go to help me fund my dream of selling my unique pieces.


Because you are funding a kiln so that I can provide for my family and start my business, I would like to thank you by creating a unique piece for you. I specialize in unique, hand painted functional pieces. I produce plates, mugs, bowls, and many more pieces that are just as beautiful as they are functional.

Where will this money go anyway?

  • All of the money will go to purchase and setup a kiln.
  • Any money that goes over the goal amount will go towards marketing my Etsy store, glazes, and supplies.

The Impact

By helping me purchase a kiln, you will provide me with the means to do the following:

* Provide for my family
* Become profitable and successful doing something I love
* Allow me to share my love of art and ceramics with others through their purchases
*Provide classes and teach children about art and ceramics

Risks & Challenges

Even if I can not fund the entire amount, I need a kiln to continue making my art and design. So I will be purchasing one one way or another. This fundraiser will help me get it quicker. All art does take time to create, so once this fundraiser has taken off, I will begin work on the Perks based on the order that people donated. 

Please Note: The cost of shipping will also dictate when I am able to ship your item. I will only be able to mail a few pieces each week due to the cost of shipping. You can contact me directly with any questions @ dabados@partypaintsohio.com



Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help me out!

  • Spread the word! If you know anyone who might be interested in any of my business, even outside of the scope of this project I would be more than willing to work with them.
  • You can easily share my Fundraiser with the awesome tools that Indiegogo created! 

Thank you for donating/spreading the word of my campaign!

story:
About this project

My History Professionally, I am a writer, author, life coach, and motivational speaker. My special focus is with people who suffer from bipolar disorder and depression; teaching people to always find the silver lining even in the darkest days. Life can be hard, but it can also be beautiful, powerful, colorful and inspiring! We just need a reminder sometimes. I have a non-profit organization called “Making Blue Happy” that focuses on making more people aware of bipolar disorder, as well as depression. I provide life coaching for individuals who are suffering from depression, bipolar disorder, anxiety, sufferers of abuse, and a number of other types of coaching.

About Yours Truly, Jo

I have also started my own greeting card line called “Yours Truly, Jo” that is targeted to individuals who do not know what to say to their friends and family who suffer from the effects of bipolar disorder and depression. My greeting cards and wall art are created especially for friends and family that struggle with bipolar/depression. It’s the perfect way to give your loved ones that extra burst of happiness they need to push forward through the rough times. I am happiest when I am helping people find happiness in life and I have dedicated my life to helping others.

What inspired the business?

No matter how much I would speak at an event or have a life coaching session, I found that people do better in life with daily reminders or something tangible to give daily encouragement. It is harder for people with bipolar disorder or depression to deal with daily setbacks and we need a little more encouraging and boosting than others. As a person who has suffered from them both almost all my life and not having anyone know what to say to me or how to help me, I have created the right words...words that will stick. As a mother of a child with ￼autism and schizophrenia, I know that sometimes parents raising a child with mental illness can use daily encouragement as well.

My Vision

Imagine a family member, long time friend of the family, or even yourself. Just think of someone who is suffering through life with a mental illness. It can be hard to manage at times. Imagine them finding strength and peace that they never knew they had. Imagine him or her being able to wake up each day face whatever they are going through and “Smile Anyway! I want this movement to go global and in order to do so; I need backers to help fund my campaign. My greeting cards and canvas art has the potential to change lives daily, who knows it may help someone in your family as well. It is my calling in life to inspire people around the world suffering from bipolar/depression. With the help from you, families will finally have the right words to say when dealing with mental illnesses.

The Funds are For

There are quite a few things I need in order to get this off the ground including: ￼• My registered TM • A high definition commercial printer • A quality screen printing machine • PR and advertising ￼The TM requires me hiring an attorney, as the process can be complicated, especially with my own design. The cost could range from $350-$1000. The commercial printer will be expensive. It could be as costly as $10,000 or more, but I have a found a few used/smaller models for $3000, A quality screen printing machine will run at least $2500 and again I don’t have to get brand name. I can find a cheaper model to start. Last but not least, PR and advertising will run me between $2000 to $10000, I will get what I am able to afford the campaign. I am the face of my brand and my story sells the brand, so I will definitely need PR.  

My stretch goal is $18,000. 

With that, I would be able to fund the registered trademark, the desktop computer, and the commercial printer, The screen printing machine and PR outright. More so, there could be funds left for additional materials always needed; paper, inks, envelopes, etc.

A Genuine Thank You

I really appreciate you taking the time to read about my pursuit, and in aiding in making my dreams become a reality. I have fused two long-time passions of mine, and I am brilliantly aware this is the route I am ready to take to fulfill my passions. I would really love your help with this endeavor! Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.

And

Feel free to contact me regarding any questions you may have about my campaign. Or with any words of wisdom or support! Thank you.

Risks and challenges

When you talk about mental illness it is still a subject that a lot of people are afraid to talk about and really dig deep in. I am prepared to be the voice and tell my story, which is not an easy one to tell, to spread awareness about mental illness and what I have to offer to the mental illness community.

story:
I'm a photographer and sound artist, living in Stonehaven, Aberdeenshire and I want to create a beautiful portrait of a much-loved woodland. 

Dunnottar Woods is sometimes referred to as "Stonehaven’s back garden", a much-loved community woodland on the edge of the town. On any day you can meet old friends walking dogs, young couples taking a stroll, families playing and a diverse range of wildlife from common garden birds to buzzards and deer. Artist David Officer is documenting a year in the life of this vital woodland, from Spring through to the end of Winter; creating a portrait of a community both wild and human. Intimate studies of woodpeckers and grey heron, time-lapse footage of the trees shedding their leaves in autumn and all mixed with the voices of the people who walk the woods every day in all the weather north-east Scotland can muster. 

We need to raise £2000 to ensure completion of this exciting project, leading to an exhibition in the woods themselves and an extensive archive of material documenting the living history of Dunnottar Woods. By supporting this project you'll be directly helping to create a vital document of our living history in north-east Scotland, preserving it's use for future generations. 
I'll be creating a rich portrait of the woodland by taking intimate photographs of the wildlife, fauna and people that spend their time there; creating a sound map of the woods and recording the voices and stories which spring from the trees; and collecting mementos of my time there as the woods change with the seasons. The result will be an in depth look at a much-loved woodland in Stonehaven and a stunning exhibition held in the woods themselves.
We've already secured the support of Forestry Commission Scotland who own Dunnottar Woods, they will provide some logistical support and vital knowledge of the woods themselves. 

How much money do we need to make this happen?

This crowdfund is to raise £2000 to go towards the costs of undertaking and completing the project. The bulk of which I'm hoping to fund through Creative Scotland funding and corporate sponsorship. The total budget for the project is currently £16, 660.
With full funding for the project, I'll be committing 18 hours a week for 48 weeks to document a year in the life of the woods. This time will include all artistic practice, administration and promotion. Calculating this time at a £10 living wage amounts to £8640.
Other costs include essential equipment, graphic design, website design and maintenance, exhibition costs, other promotion and a small contingency fund.
If the only funding we get is from this Indiegogo page then the project can still go ahead but I will be working for free. That means I might not be able to spend as much time on the project as I hoped, simply because I might have to take on some more paid jobs so that I can eat. The scope of the project will still be huge though and the money from raised here will allow us to have a website, buy essential equipment like a camera trap for capturing images of shy wildlife and holding an exhibition in the woods themselves. Without any funding though, there is no project.
As a thank you for your support, there's an exciting perks package for you to choose from:
  • 1 on 1 photography lesson in Dunnottar Woods
  • Guided tour of the woods
  • Guided tour of Stonehaven featuring Dunnottar Woods, Dunnottar Castle, the historic harbour, Cowie and Skatie Shore. Followed by a drink on the harbour wall
  • A very ltd handmade book featuring images from the project and a usb stick full of digital images and sounds
  • Photographic prints that feature in the project
  • If You Go Down to the Woods Today... CD in handmade woodland theme cover

If we don't reach the goal then the project will still go ahead provided all other funding has been achieved. In the event that there is a critical lack of other funding then the project may be cancelled and indiegogo funding returned.

My background and expertise

I graduated from Aberdeen College in 2006 with an HND in Professional Photography and have been developing my practice over the last 7 years including a stint as a studio photographer for a major family portrait company. My passion has always been nature photography though. This project allows me to document a woodland close to my heart, exploring the wildlife and recording the stories from the people who use the woods. 

Having successfully completed a crowdfunding project in 2013, you can have confidence that I'll deliver on the project goals and perks. That project was a major commission for the Fram Museum in Oslo which resulted in a performance at an opening event attended by the King and Prime Minister of Norway. You can have faith that I have experience delivering high quality work to a standard fit for a King. 

I also work in Marketing and Communications, so I have the expertise needed to ensure the project is promoted successfully, meaning you'll be supporting a successful and exciting project.

Risks & Challenges

There are a number of minor risks associated with this project. The main one being that other sources of funding aren't successful meaning the project would have to be abandoned or changed drastically. The chances of this are slim as I work in the cultural sector and have strong knowledge of constructing funding applications. In the event of any critical failures of funding, I will ensure clear communication with project backers and if the project is cancelled, pledges will be refunded.

I will have photographers insurance in place so equipment failure will only result in a change to timetabled tasks while a replacement is sourced.

The other main risk is that something happens to me which means I am unable to complete the project. Rest assured it would have to be something fairly serious to lead to a project stop. In the event of illness or other incident, I will ensure as much communication with backers as possible but money may not be returned if the project is under way.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can afford to support an art project. If you think it sounds cool and still want to support it without giving me any money, then please share the project on social media or with friends. The more shares we get, the better our chance of hitting the target.

Thanks for supporting If You Go Down To The Woods Today...

story:
• Help Artist Miguel Hine exhibit to exhibit his work at Art EXPO New York. 2015. April 23rd-26th. PIER 94. 
Introduction: 
Hello my name is Miguel Hine and I was born in San Jose, Costa Rica.  I moved with my family to the United States at a very young age and currently reside in Key Biscayne, FL. 
Living in the United States most of my life has allowed me the wonderful opportunity to study Fine Arts and painting at two of the top art schools in the nation, The New World School of the Arts and the Maryland Institute College of Art on full-scholarship.

Ever since I was 5 years old I can still recall expressing my desire to my family and loved ones's about my dreams of one day becoming a famous artist. There is nothing more I have ever wanted for myself, It has been my life long dream and goal which I know I will one day achieve. 

Campaign Goal: 

I recently was contacted by the Bernard Solco gallery, a prominent art gallery located in New York City. The curator and owner are very interested in my work. In fact, their compliments and the way they spoke of my work left me quite floored, humbled. More importantly, we discussed the possibility of myself Artist Miguel Hine being one of four artists exhibiting / represented by this gallery at this year's Artexpo New York April 23rd -26th | Pier 94. Now, the flip side, of course these opportunities don't come free of charge and I would have to raise the funds to travel and participate in a four day exhibit in New York City this coming April. I need your help to make this dream a reality.


Where do your your money go. How can contributors help. There is everything from the gallery fee, to shipping my artwork to NYC.  My Airline air fare fee. Living expensive.  For example a proper place to sleep,  Preferably a hotel, I'm doing my best to reach out to a few friend's in NYC. about sofa option's but they all live kinda far from my Expo / location.. Could be difficult.  The best option is to be in Manhattan close to the Art Expo so I can conveniently travel between the Expo/Work and Hotel. Enjoy what is the Art capital of the world in between during my free time. ..visit the Guggenheim and MOMA.. It's been over 20 years. I need this level of experience, this learning experience, exposure, and environment more then ever before in my life. Total inspiration for an artist that holds a gift that deserves to nourish grow.  Here's my opportunity. I've never be more ready. 
Miguel Hine. 

Please follow these link's for more information.

- www.artexponewyork.com

- www.miguelhinehine.com

-  http://igg.me/at/artistmiguelhine 

- www.miguelhine.wordpress.com
- www.bernardsolco.comhttps://www.facebook.com/artistmiguelhine?ref=hl#

story_txt:
Help Artist Miguel Hine exhibit to exhibit his work at Art EXPO New York. 2015. April 23rd-26th. PIER 94. 

Introduction: Hello my name is Miguel Hine and I was born in San Jose, Costa Rica.  I moved with my family to the United States at a very young age and currently reside in Key Biscayne, FL. Living in the United States most of my life has allowed me the wonderful opportunity to study Fine Arts and painting at two of the top art schools in the nation, The New World School of the Arts and the Maryland Institute College of Art on full-scholarship.


Ever since I was 5 years old I can still recall expressing my desire to my family and loved ones's about my dreams of one day becoming a famous artist. There is nothing more I have ever wanted for myself, It has been my life long dream and goal which I know I will one day achieve. 

Campaign Goal: 
I recently was contacted by the Bernard Solco gallery, a prominent art gallery located in New York City. The curator and owner are very interested in my work. In fact, their compliments and the way they spoke of my work left me quite floored, humbled. More importantly, we discussed the possibility of myself Artist Miguel Hine being one of four artists exhibiting / represented by this gallery at this year's Artexpo New York April 23rd -26th | Pier 94. Now, the flip side, of course these opportunities don't come free of charge and I would have to raise the funds to travel and participate in a four day exhibit in New York City this coming April. I need your help to make this dream a reality.
Where do your your money go. How can contributors help. There is everything from the gallery fee, to shipping my artwork to NYC.  My Airline air fare fee. Living expensive.  For example a proper place to sleep,  Preferably a hotel, I'm doing my best to reach out to a few friend's in NYC. about sofa option's but they all live kinda far from my Expo / location.. Could be difficult.  The best option is to be in Manhattan close to the Art Expo so I can conveniently travel between the Expo/Work and Hotel. Enjoy what is the Art capital of the world in between during my free time. ..visit the Guggenheim and MOMA.. It's been over 20 years. I need this level of experience, this learning experience, exposure, and environment more then ever before in my life. Total inspiration for an artist that holds a gift that deserves to nourish grow.  Here's my opportunity. I've never be more ready. Miguel Hine. 


Please follow these link's for more information.
- www.artexponewyork.com
- www.miguelhinehine.com
-  http://igg.me/at/artistmiguelhine 
- www.miguelhine.wordpress.com- www.bernardsolco.comhttps://www.facebook.com/artistmiguelhine?ref=hl#

story:
About us:

4mamaearth is an LA based community organization founded in 2007 by Jaime Kailani Bayot, big sister to international superstar Bruno Mars. The 4mamaearth mission is to use the power of art, music and nature to make a change for the better, locally and globally. We partner with schools, universities, community centers, hospitals and more to present all ages enrichment classes & events. We have followers in more than 40 countries with chapters in Brazil, Chile, Germany, Indonesia and the Philippines with young people planting trees, cleaning up neighborhoods and collecting clothes and toys for shelters and orphanages.

About Coloring Mandalas:

Recently, we took our COLORING MANDALAS project to Loma Linda University Children's Hospital to bring coloring kits to children and families stuck in their hospital rooms and also to color along with us.

A mandala is a spiritual symbol representing the universe. Mandalas can be found in every culture and religion. Coloring Mandalas is way to express hidden parts of yourself and explore the spiritual process as it unfolds with color and texture.

Benefits of mandalas include:
1. Relieve tension, anxiety, fear and worry
2. Relax and heal the mind, body and spirit.
3. Stimulate creative thinking and problem-solving.

It's an ancient art form for all ages!

"Art helps kids to express themselves and not focus so much on the pain", says Myra Benitez, Manager of Social Work at Loma Linda University Children's Hospital.

What We Need 

Each coloring kit includes several mandala coloring sheets, coloring tools (like pencils, crayons or markers) and a postcard insert with how-to directions.

It costs about $5 for each coloring kit. If we reach our goal, we can create 100 coloring kits! 

Our plan is to bring this project to more hospitals, shelters and place there are kids in need. The more money we raise, the more coloring kits we can provide to reach more children so please help us meet and exceed our goal!

The Impact of Art Therapy

When you contribute to this campaign, you are helping children in a profound way. Art therapy for children can provide kids with an easier way to express themselves since a young child is likely to be more comfortable expressing him/herself with some crayons and markers, for example, than he/she is going to be at expressing emotions and feelings through words. Art therapy can help children dealing with:

  • mental health problems
  • grief and/or loss 
  • learning disabilities
  • emotional problems
  • abuse of any kind
  • cancer or terminal illness

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and tell your friends and family about our campaign!

We Thank You!

story:
“Da Dee At!” (“Don’t Do It!”) is a performance art festival set up at the Aberdeen beach.

'Cocking a snook' at the long standing remonstration by parents of their children at play; at home, in the street, or out somewhere special – like the beach – this live art/performance project aims to get in touch (in a constructive way!) with that age-old childish instinct to break the rule, to try the new, to push at the boundary, to gently challenge the status quo.

The live art/performance art form is the ideal vehicle for such an ambitious objective.  It is an art form unique in its accessibility, to both audience and artist; it is invariably neither precious, nor intimidating; it does not rely on any one artistic skill set or prior knowledge by the audience of the same; it takes place in the moment, of which the audience is an integral part; and it can take place in locations outside of the normal confines of artistic expression – the concert hall, the gallery, the museum. Drawing on that, the project’s main goal is to provide interactive pieces of art which will allow the audience to get personally and physically engaged and break the elitist concept of the fourth wall.

A background theme of the project is nostalgia for the past grandeur and significance of the Aberdeen beach holiday that goes back to the first half of the 20th century, when Aberdeen was the main summer holiday destination for the rest of Scotland.  We believe that an art festival in the form of a late summer, beach picnic will encourage an informal and energetic atmosphere for the performances, in which the artists shall be specifically asked to reflect on their memories of retro beach activities. The project could be viewed as a small counter to the commercialisation of the beach area in recent years.

The programme would consist of approx. 12 performances, held over a weekend, and possibly one day either side, including probably some evening performances, at the end of September 2015.  A base will be established at the beach, located probably in the vicinity of the bus stops and beach cafes in order to maximise accessibility and visibility.   Some performances might be located at some distance away, along the beach, in which case transport would be provided for any audience needing it. 

Documentary footage of the day’s performances will be screened each night – harking back to the era of the ‘city of silver screens’ - complementing talks and discussion, in a nearby ‘festival pub/café’. 

The artists would be selected by the panel after considering submissions in response to an open invitation to participate.  The invitation and selection would probably be done on a 2-tier basis – local and outwith Aberdeen – to ensure a fair representation of local artists as well as to keep costs down.

story:
We are a group of light workers, healers, shamans, therapists, counselors,  magicians and general lovers who have embarked on the mission of creating sacred spaces to nurture, share and embrace our truest nature. Over the past 10 years we have created a number of sacred spaces at various music festivals around Australia. These multi sensory meccas embrace infinite patterns of light, sound, dance and crystalline geometry, with the intent to anchor 5d consciousness into a personal planetary visual experience. 

We create spaces where magic happens..

Highly skilled in their craft and experts in many understandings, we work through the divine light to help all achieve mastery. With over 100 of us working together, we are raising funds to build a mobile light temple that can be deployed at festivals and events around Australia. In conjunction with the Abundance Foundation and Lightworkers.org, we have the transport and logistics to bring the magic to the people. We just need a little extra community support to complete our wish list and make it happen.

We create spaces that inspire joy and laughter..

With over 12 years of Light temple building experience and a team of over 100 divine warriors, we bring a space and a crew that are present and totally ready to raise the frequency of any location in time and space. More complete than ever before, this highly charged and expertly crafted sacred space weaves these magical technologies in from the solar ring and beyond. This beautiful zone will inspire, entertain and amaze you. A place of alignment, balance, clarity and connection - oozing with divine presence, art and healing.

We create spaces that uplift the energy of any event..

With your help and contribution we can carry the magic everywhere, sharing the knowledge through patterns of light, sound, dance and crystalline geometry. This space will be waiting to support and welcome beautiful souls that are ready to share, guide, learn and embrace.

The cost for the dome structure of the Crystal Mandala temple is $1,800. A generator to backup our existing solar rig will cost approx $1,200. (See figures below) All funding will go towards creating a highly charged and energetic space fueled by love of all things beyond - assisting and guiding one another on this spiritual path of love, abundance, healing and health. The mandala sustains activated star portals, as such, multi dimensional awareness is totally accessible through the transcendental star codes and the crystalline Gaia gates.

We create spaces that nurture the soul..

Our space is a valuable and important place to nurture the souls that have engaged in spiritual development and have the tools and expertise to share their divine power to others assisting in a planetary shift of consciousness. A place that nurtures wisdom, love and through participation and funding we can make this all happen. All funding goes straight towards the light temple. Our Light temple is unique. Filled with lightworker's of many skilled crafts, experts in many understandings of the divine light and shadow. We are here to share experiences with higher states of awareness, a variety of healing modalities, dance, performance and any support possible to enhance, calm or bring clarity to those ready for this epic journey of the soul.

We weave our magic through Dance..

We as a team want to be there ready and accessible to any person willing, searching or guided to us; a place built on values of service and teaching, acceptance and love all ready to participate in our beautiful new world of light, magic and fun. A magical place of healing will await your presence and welcome any support you can offer to create this magical abode.

We create a space for all to participate..

We hold a strong trust that our space will be created and funded by those that hold our words to be true. We trust that with the divinity and intention of healing and helping others our space will go through with the contributions of all that hear our words from the heart and see the truth and transparency of our nature and readiness to serve you.

We weave our magic through transcendental beats..

And so, our mega media frequency light temple creation of light and love, will be a planetary visual experience activated with style through love, light and laughter. These frequencies offer an accurate grasp of our full potential and our evolutionary connection and life path with each other, our most sacred Gaia and the all encompassing Great Spirit. We will be ready and waiting for you!

We create from a place of love and compassion..

With the fantastic help of Indiegogo.org, we get to share our vision and allow anyone felt guided to us to contribute and be a part of the beauty of sharing of our gifts. Thanks to you we can have this Crystal Mandala Temple awaiting your arrival at Rainbow Serpent Festival 2015 and hopefully more events around Australia so we can all shine on as one happy light family. Anyone contributing or reading this campaign who wants to help out more, SHARE this link with all of your friends to spread the word so we can make this happen as fast as possible!

We weave our magic through Song..

For all the people, all the time, we love, honour and respect you.  Walking together we thrive!


What We Have:

The Abundance Bus. (Vegie Oil Powered) 40ft Isuzu Coach (School bus) for transport and solar power rig, 700ltrs Water and Crew Kitchen (Above)

1000kw Solar power system with 1000ah batteries and 3000w Inverter

Carpet, Cushions, Crystals, Decore, Sacred Artwork

Sound system and Lighting

Visual Projectors

 

Whats Required : ($3000)

$1000 for the 8m Dome Structure

$800 for the 8m Dome Cover

$1200 for a Silent 5kva Diesel Generator (To backup solar on cloudy days) we can also convert this to run on Vegie Oil or use Bio Diesel.




Any Additional Funds will go to purchasing some new large crystal pieces.


Thank you.. and much love from Adeon and the whole Light Temple Crew.
And a special Big Thanks to Kylie and Caitlan for helping setup our Indiegogo campaign!

story:
My Story

My passion, my paintings are about bringing the deep wisdom of our collective ancestral roots into form as a visual tale that can hopefully liberate one's connection to the infinite spirit that flows through all living things.  I want you to feel what it means to "breathe LOVE" when you embrace the imagery I share with you on canvas.  Just simply allowing yourself to feel moved from one of my paintings will bring me great joy!  And this is exactly why I applied to paint at Envision Festival, because I want to inspire people to open their hearts, feel the abundant love and aliveness within themselves, and embrace the courage it takes to create the life of one's dreams.  We are co-creating this incredible journey together, so why not create a life that values joy, growth, gratitude, compassion, and inner beauty.  All this comes to life, and pours abundantly out of my heart, and in to my paintings.  The growth I've found training under Alex Grey, Allison Grey, and Michael Divine has inspired me to keep pushing myself to greater depths of honing my craft and sharing my message with the world.  I want to share my art with the 1500+ travelers that will be at Envision Festival, and YOU can help this vision come to LIFE!  Any amount of support that you are willing to donate to my vision, will help TREMENDOUSLY with my efforts of cultivating my passion into a reality :)  Your donation will help support me in making prints of my art, so that a painting like, Free as a Bird, might have the chance to reach hearts across the globe.  Every little bit makes a huge difference in my future as an artist, and in OUR future of a culture that values the gifts an artist can PLANT for the seeds of CHANGE!!"

While Jess was selected to be a live painter at Envision, all of the other expenses associated with going to an event in Central America fall on Jess's shoulders.  Airfare.  Shipping art supplies there.  Making prints of her artwork.  Transportation.  Lodging.  It all adds up quickly.  That's why Jess needs your help to make this dream come true.

Here's What Jess Needs 

Jess is trying to raise at least $2,999 to help cover her expenses:  

  • $124 - This will cover the cost of scanning 2 of my paintings on professional grade scanners, in order to have high quality prints made
  • $800 - This will cover 200 giclee 8 x 12 inch prints 
  • $650 - This will cover 50 giclee 16 x 20 inch prints
  • $1150 - This will cover airfare and lodging to Costa Rica
  • $100 - This will cover the airport shuttle
  • $75    - This will cover the cost of framing the piece above, so it will look professional when displayed at Envision Festival's gallery
  • $100 - This will cover shipping the original painting above, prints, and art supplies needed for doing the live painting at Envision

While this is a lot of money to raise, any little bit helps.  Any money that is raised will help defer the out of pocket costs for the trip and for making prints.

Here's What You Get

    Jess is offering various types of artwork for your support that you can see in her indiegogo gallery (OR, just scroll down to see them at the bottom of this page), including original paintings and prints of her latest paintings.  Jess has given brief descriptions of the items.  If there are any questions feel free to message her.  She can be reached at jessicalaprade@gmail.com and is happy to explain any of the items in more detail for you.

    There are examples of all of the available prints and paintings in the gallery section.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can help get the word out and make some noise about my campaign: word of mouth, sharing on social media networks (Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, etc.), or helping Jess pin up and hand out flyers.
  • Indiegogo has all the share tools needed to make it as easy as one click!
  • Jess also has a plethora of her original paintings for sale through her website (If you see a piece you're interested in but don't see it for sale, just ask.  There are many needy paintings that would love a good home): www.jessicalaprade.weebly.com , and through my shop on Etsy: www.etsy.com/shop/JessLaPradeART
  • Now you know what Jess is looking for, so if you have helpful tips or suggestions for people in the know for any of the above, she would love to hear your thoughts.  

Your help is gratefully appreciated.  Thank you!!


PICTURES OF AWESOME PERKS BELOW...   


TOTE BAG- 3 Images (Free As a Bird, Sea Gift, and Infinite Bliss) 



TOTE BAG- Sea Gift



TOTE BAG- Free As a Bird


The End of the Cycle


Spirit Feathers

The Seedling: Interconnected


Phoenix Rising


The Root of Bliss


Flying Into the Red


Heartbeats


PRINTS:  Free As a Bird


PRINTS: Sea Gift -Original painting available on Etsy

story:
Cigarettes for Art

Hello. I'm a 23 year old artist who smokes the equivalent of 1 pack of cigarettes a day. I currently smoke hand-rolled cigarettes with no filters so that the silicon filter does not impose environmental damage to the world. That said there are lots of cigarette butts that need to be cleaned up. Because, the filters are essentially non-biodegradable, it does not even make sense to throw them in the trash. However, I will start collecting cigarette butts, starting in Minneapolis for a week, and eventually full-time to Chicago for 12 hours a day and I will be using the liter I pick up to make art objects. The grand project will be to reconstruct the Medinah Temple in Chicago with cigarette butts to introduce the Black Swan project. My goal is to donate whatever money I raise to eventually buying the Medinah Temple and restoring it to its original purpose of being a place of worship and contemplation for the community. The Black Swan Project is a literary/artistic project that seeks to establish a space to publish and forward the arts. The newly designed Medinah Temple would house studios, performance venues, offices, and community spaces that would engage the public and support creative individuals.
Here are some reasons for why you might want to donate to this cause:
1. If you want cigarette butts off the streets for personal or environmental reasons
2. If you want cool art objects made out of cigarette filters
3. If you think Chicago can become a first-tier art city once again

story:
Miami Loco or Bust!!

It's that time a year... time for the 6th annual Miami Loco art walk!

This year will be bigger than ever with more than 40 acts, 32 poets and performers and 50 visual artists.  While the festival is still free to the public, this year we are asking for you support to help with the costs of the event.. One of our greatest expenses this year is providing gas money for the 40+ acts making the journey to Miami, AZ for the weekend.. Please help us pay their gas and in return choose for your self from the available perks including T-shirts, posters and stickers.   Thank you for supporting this year's Miami Loco Art Walk..

---------------------------------------------------------

6TH ANNUAL MIAMI LOCO ARTS FESTIVAL, MIAMI AZ

Saturday & Sunday March 21 - 22, 2015 

Miami, AZ – Come experience and explore Arizona art history-in-the-making. Join us and promote the 6TH ANNUAL MIAMI LOCO ARTS FESTIVAL in historic Miami, Arizona, east of The Valley of the Sun on Highway 60.

The Miami Loco Arts Festival is an all-inclusive art walk held in the springtime in Miami, Arizona.  Miami Loco is an art walk of diverse cultures, all-ages and tastes – from traditional to contemporary, folk, landscape, genre’ and multi-media artworks.  Come visit art galleries, antique shops, storefronts and studios that are participating with new art installations, music concerts, poetry and stage performances. 

Saturday and Sunday, all of the art spaces will be open from 11am. Maps and event schedules will be posted and available. 

Miami Art Works will have the Miami Loco Group Show, "SECRET CITY" with live music outdoors in the Courtyard. Performance schedules and artists to be confirmed.

For a special treat, please join us for our annual twilight procession Saturday evening at select galleries. The poets gather with participants for the art walk, candles and poems. 

Sunday morning starts up at 11am with a pancake breakfast in the courtyard of Miami Art Works. Spend the rest of the day wandering our beautiful town, seeing art and meeting artists.

************************************

Today, Miami has become the new “Boomtown” of the arts, harnessing a new “Art West” spirit of the traditional and the contemporary, with a broad vision of community, diverse cultures, bridging the old with the new.

The Town of Miami is located 70 miles East of Phoenix on Highway 60 – the “Old West Highway" travels through the most scenic landscape in Arizona.  

6TH ANNUAL MIAMI LOCO ARTS FESTIVAL is sponsored by the Miami Arts Commission and select patrons of the arts. 

https://www.facebook.com/MiamiArtWorks

https://www.facebook.com/miamilocoartsfestival

http://www.miamiartscommission.org/
