story:
About

Counter Culture is a Saginaw based Art Gallery and Music Venue, registered as a non-profit in the State of Michigan. With an emphasis on every area in the Humanities, Counter Culture serves as an Art Collective and social hub. It gives people from every walk of life a chance to mingle and participate in building and fortifying a healthy culture. A novice may grace the same stage that a veteran professional controlled only a week early. This gives the community the chance to see how it is done and to cut their teeth giving it a shot.

Counter Culture specializes in art receptions and music events, but it doesn’t end there. Any member of the community may propose an event and work to see it achieved. Writing workshops, social demonstrations, seminars, lectures, yoga, community bike rides, urban planning and so much more, start within the walls of Counter Culture. This is real world application of what is usually only found inside intellectual or academic circles.

History

The History of Counter Culture the entity is only one year old. But in that short time it has impacted and participated in a burgeoning renaissance. The two facilitators of the venture, Curtis Dalton and Benjamin Champagne, have been involved in the arts for over a decade, but many more have come through to help with 20 plus years. Counter Culture has been around in the hearts of people for centuries. It is more about a movement that is already taking place and the community of Saginaw getting behind it and supporting it. Counter Culture has worked with nationally touring musicians, artists spanning the country, organizations within the city, high school students and nearly everything in between. It doesn’t matter what demographic you find yourself in, Counter Culture has something for you; Age, Sex, Race, Class does not matter. All can participate together and compose their own meaning.

During the months of April and May, Counter Culture saw a few thousand inside its doors. All glowing faces and bright smiles. Many lives were touched and enhanced. Many people learned that they could oversee a project and dream to it’s finish. Unfortunately, due to several conflicts, we were forced to leave the location we were in and find a new home.  As you can see, we have and it’s only a few blocks away from the original site.  We wish to continue that and show the country how cities that suffered from the collapse of industry come back to life.

Students and parents fill the room for a poetry slam featuring students from the Saginaw Arts & Sciences Academy.

What We Need

Counter Culture is set to open the new building up to the public very soon. Nothing will stop this, but it would be much better if some last minute odds and ends were tightened up. A good cultural hub can serve as a destination and help to make a city look a little brighter on a map. This is an investment in your community. Imagine if the SVSU students that enrolled from out of town took a great interest in this city! Imagine a town full of people happy, content and producing with one another. One movement like Counter Culture is all it takes to help adjust the tone for an entire community.

Our biggest supports and resources are the people that have helped us along the way, or at least have come to see what all the noise is about, but unfortunately, a necessary piece of this puzzle is funding.  We have already sunk tens of thousands of our own dollars into this venture, and we only need a little more help to get all the way there.  Small contributions add up, and the dreams of many come true.

Timeline

There is no time like the present and we like to illustrate that in our work habits and deadlines. It’s a carpe diem attitude that we admire in all the greats before us. We have much of the help we need to make everything happen, now we need community support in the form of voting with dollars.  While some of this budget is needed immediately, other parts of it will benefit the small artistic community we’ve gathered in the coming months.

Hundreds of fans enjoy a concert in the former gallery room.

Budget

Until the move, we had never been ones to ask for handouts or beg for help, but in the last few months, humility has….  Counter Culture is our dream, and we get an immense amount of satisfaction out of providing it to our community, but we are only two young adults.  This entire thing has been funded out of own pockets, and with all the recent expenses, we are near financial exhaustion.  While Counter Culture has proven to be self-sustaining as an ongoing business, starting up in a new building - that wasn’t exactly move in ready - has taken it’s toll, which is why we are asking for your help over this initial hump.



Though the expenses of what is yet to be done will probably double or triple what we’re asking for, contributions will definitely help us get there.  Here’s a small breakdown of our campaign goal, and how funds raised will be distributed.


$1,500 - Upgrading to an industry standard, quality live sound and lighting system to provide an incredible experience for both performers and audience.

$1,500 - Framing, Electrical Work, Plumbing, Permitting, including the build out of a retail space, a sound booth, a concessions area and more.  A big part of this expense is also making sure we are fully ADA / Handicap compliant.

$500 - In order to let people know we exist, we need a decent, lighted sign.  The name Counter Culture deserves to SHINE!

$500 - The new building is great, but for the look a true gallery really needs, it needs a fresh coat of paint or two, inside and out.  Help us with a few dozen gallons.

$500 - Annual dancehall license, master business license, and legal and filing fees towards converting into a 501c3 non-profit organization.

$1,000 - Programming for youth (as well as adults) like art classes and workshops, music lessons/get togethers and more are so important to us.  Help us make these possible and frequent.


Any funds raised in excess of our goal will go toward additional programs involving local schools, youth and the effort to keep the doors of Counter Culture open, as a community ‘safe place’, regularly.


These are some of the things we do:

Live Concerts : For years, one of the only ways to get a live concert experience in Saginaw has been by either going to a large arena, or braving the late night (or morning) at a local bar.  What Counter Culture does is provide a safe place for patrons of all ages to experience live, original music up close and personal.  In any given month, dozens of Michigan bands, and a handful of out-of-state, or even out-of-country bands will grace our stage, making it a great place to discover new music, or for our area youth, even play a first show.

Art Exhibitions : Serving as the area's only venue of it's kind, Counter Culture features both local artists, and those from far away; tradional art, as well as the bizaare.

Comedy & Theatre : These avenues of the arts are not only ones for drinking environments.  In the past, Counter Culture was host to a 'comedy game night' similar to "Who's Line Is It Anyway?"  We will move forward with it, stand-up and eventually, theatre!

Health & Fitness : Physical health is just as important to a healthy mind and making/viewing the arts as anything else.  In the past, we have been a host to a yoga class, and were are currently behind a weekly community bike ride.  We will continue both of these activities, and add more in the near future.

Programs For Students : Though we have only served as host to one student function, SASA Soothes The Counter Culture in May 2015, our plan is to expand this part of the organization as much as possible.  Coming months will see us extending our hand to every school in the county, to offer safe after hours activities relating to art, music, literature and more.

Workshops / Clubs : One of the coolest things about Counter Culture is the wide range of talent that walks through its doors.  Writing, art, and wellness workshops allow the great minds of our community to share their gifts.

Dream Factory : It’s title may sound silly, but this is one of our favorite parts of the entire collective.  In creating Counter Culture, all we were doing taking our ideas and turning them into reality.  We didn’t ask for [much] help, we didn’t ask for anyone’s permission, and we didn’t let obstacles, big or small, get in our way.  The ‘just do it’ mentality of Counter Culture is an exercise in both creativity and confidence.  We want to show people that when you put your mind and heart to something, you can accomplish it!  That being said, one of the missions of Counter Culture is to stimulate, encourage and nurture this line of thinking; helping others to bring their ideas to life whenever possible.


During the brief time we were open, we made a little bit of noise in the local media.  See for yourselves :

Print Press

  • M Live - The Saginaw News : http://www.mlive.com/entertainment/saginaw/index.ssf/2015/04/all_ages_art_music_venue_count.html

  • SVSU Valley Vanguard : http://www.valleyvanguardonline.com/?p=6287

  • Opening Weekend Photography : http://www.saginawhappening.org/2015/04/counter-culture-opening-weekend-in-saginaw-mi/

  • Bay Area Review : http://review-mag.com/article/counter-culture-new-arts-collective-in-old-town-saginaw-seeks-to-seeks-to-serve-as-an-artistic-hub-of-the-great-lakes-bay

  • Delta College Collegiate : http://deltacollegiate.altervista.org/creative-space-in-saginaw-hopes-to-bring-counter-culture-to-the-tri-cities/

Television / Video Press

  • WNEM CBS TV5 : http://www.wnem.com/story/28758182/counter-culture-is-coming-to-old-town

  • ABC 12 : http://www.abc12.com/home/headlines/Counter-Culture-ready-for-grand-opening-in-Old-Town-Saginaw-299064241.html

  • Delta Collegiate Stream : Tri-City Hotspot: Counter Culture, Saginaw

  • SASA Speaks Poetry reading : FREE POETRY NIGHT

  • ABC 12 Mid-Michigan Music : http://www.abc12.com/news/midmichiganmusicscene/headlines/Sworn-Enemy-breaking-in-new-Saginaw-club-301535811.html

  • Thor*tography Prep Video : https://vimeo.com/122938358

  • Cradle The Fall concert : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xyo1czV5lOo

  • American Opera concert (final show at first location) : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JQYKq68oGaQ

story:
Un camion de livraison-théâtre sur le pas de votre porte.

Theatre delivery to your doorstep.

(ENGLISH VERSION WILL FOLLOW AT BOTTOM)

LE PROJET

Une envie de partage, un rêve d’autonomie, un goût de défi et de rencontres. Inspirée par des initiatives extraordinaires récentes dans le merveilleux monde du camion, la toute fraîche compagnie de théâtre La Fille Du Laitier souhaite concrétiser son projet de camion de livraison-théâtre. Si l’un développe une bibliothèque roulante et l’autre une buanderie itinérante accessible aux sans-abri, La Fille Du Laitier, elle, propose un théâtre de proximité qui soit abordable, accessible et original. Nous désirons offrir un divertissement de qualité professionnelle en surprenant le spectateur au détour de sa rue, dans le parc où il pique-nique, dans sa ruelle ou dans une fête de quartier! La Fille Du Laitier veut faire son chemin jusqu’aux gens moins initiés au théâtre en leur facilitant l’accès et en provoquant des rencontres théâtrales dans des endroits qui leur sont familiers. Nous souhaitons rejoindre le passant, le travailleur, le touriste ou bien la famille qui ne peut se permettre une sortie au théâtre. La Fille Du Laitier veut faire son chemin jusque sur le pas de votre porte !

LE CAMION

Notre camion, c’est un ancien camion de pompiers volontaires, il mesure 22 pieds, il a 6 roues, il fait bip-bip quand on recule et il est couleur ambulance (pour le moment!). Il a un bon coeur, un bon moteur et La Fille Du Laitier est prête à passer aux choses sérieuses! Nous sommes allés présenter la bête à l’équipe de Big Dog Gripping qui oeuvre dans le monde du cinéma et qui transforme toutes sortes de véhicules en machines du futur! Ils ont les connaissances mécaniques pour bien remettre sur pieds (ou sur roues!) le camion et les connaissances électriques pour créer des systèmes ingénieux de son et d’éclairage pour que nous soyons indépendants. Ils ont les outils pour ouvrir le côté du camion pour construire une scène efficiente. Ils ont l’expérience, la passion, le gigantesque garage et les idées pour transformer le camion en une salle de théâtre ambulante!

L’ÉQUIPE

La Fille Du Laitier c’est Caroline Bélanger, Marie-Hélène Bélanger et Jon Lachlan Stuart, tous récents diplômés de l’école nationale de théâtre du Canada. Professionnels en arts de la scène, expérimentés dans la création, l’écriture dramatique, la tournée et les performances extérieures, ils sont inventifs, talentueux et fonceurs! Ils sont maintenant en train de démystifier les grands secrets des OBNL, de l’enregistrement au registraire des entreprises du Québec et de revenu Québec. Laissons-leur un moment, ça va aller… 

Vous aimeriez voir un camion de livraison-théâtre surgir dans votre cour ou sur votre place publique préférée? 

Vous avez envie de supporter un théâtre abordable et accessible ?

Vous désirez supporter des artistes de la relève théâtrale ?

Aidez-nous à construire notre salle ambulante en nous soutenant financièrement ! Vous nous verrez sans doute l’été prochain sur un coin de rue près de chez vous !

(ENGLISH)

THE VISION 

A desire to share, a dream of autonomy, and a flavour of defiance and of surprise encounters is in the heart of our company. Inspired by the recent boom of food truck culture, our new company, La Fille Du Laitier, wants to develop the first Canadian Theatre Foodtruck.

Where other entrepreneurs have developed projects like a mobile library truck, or a mobile Laundromat for the homeless, La Fille Du Laitier envisions a foodtruck that will open and transform into a full stage.

Recent graduates of the Ecole Nationale de Theatre in Montreal, LFDL presents professional quality theatre to those who don’t necessarily get out to see it, inviting spectators to experience plays during a picnic, in an alleyway near their home, or during festivals or block parties

THE TRUCK

Our truck is an old volounteer ambulance, measuring 22 feet; it has six wheels and beeps when you back up. It’s a big job.

It’s got a good heart and a good motor and we’re ready to jump to the transformation process, but we need support!

We’ve teamed up with Big Dog gripping, a company working with vehicle transformation for stunts in films. They’ve estimated the job to cost between 10,000$ and 15,000$, to cover everything from adding sound systems, lighting systems, and to organize the basic mechanics of cutting a side of the truck to open and close for performances.

Our financial goal for this part of our development is to hit our 15,000$ mark, to cover these first costs!

WHERE WE’RE AT

La Fille Du Laitier is Caroline Bélanger, Marie-Hélène Bélanger and Jon Lachlan Stewart, all recent graduates of the National Theatre school of Canada. With a long background in theatre arts, experimental theatre creation, playwriting, and touring in outdoor theatre, this company is inventif, talented and commited to this vision.

The main obstacle we face with our project is beginning. This is a large investment, and we’re just learning the ropes in terms of engineering and mechanics! But the Theatre Foodtruck is at the spirit of the origins of Theatre, even back to Shakespeare: a live performance, free for all, in the heart of each community. We feel that this is a project with a huge cause and huge drive!

Do you believe in seeing theatre delivery shows, in your backyard, or in your favourite public hangout?

Do you believe in accessible and affordable entertainment for everyone!

Are you interested in supporting the emerging theatre scene in Canada?

Help us build our Theatre Foodtruck!! We promise, if you help us reach our goals, you’ll be seeing us on your corner soon.

de Big Dog Gripping qui oeuvre dans le monde du cinéma
et qui transforme toutes sortes de véhicules en machines du futur! Ils ont les connaissances mécaniques pour bien remettre sur pieds (ou sur
roues!) le camion et les connaissances électriques
pour créer des systèmes ingénieux de son
et d’éclairage pour que nous soyons indépendants.
Ils ont les outils pour ouvrir le côté du camion
pour construire une scène efficiente. Ils ont l’expérience,
la passion, le gigantesque garage et les idées
pour transformer le camion en une salle de théâtre
ambulante! 
L’ÉQUIPE
La Fille Du Laitier c’est
Caroline Bélanger, Marie-Hélène Bélanger et
Jon Lachlan Stuart, tous récents diplômés de
l’école nationale de théâtre du Canada. Professionnels en arts de la scène,
expérimentés dans la création,
l’écriture dramatique, la tournée et les
performances extérieures, ils sont inventifs, talentueux et
fonceurs! Ils sont maintenant en train de démystifier
les grands secrets des OBNL, de l’enregistrement au registraire des entreprises du
Québec et de revenu Québec. Laissons-leur un moment, ça va
aller… Vous aimeriez voir un camion de livraison-théâtre surgir dans votre cour ou sur votre place publique préférée? 
Vous avez envie de supporter un théâtre
abordable et accessible ? 
Vous désirez
supporter des artistes de la relève théâtrale ? 
Aidez-nous à construire
notre salle ambulante en nous soutenant financièrement
! Vous nous verrez sans doute l’été prochain sur un coin de rue près de
chez vous ! (ENGLISH)
THE VISION  
A desire to share,
a dream of autonomy, and a flavour of defiance and of surprise encounters is in
the heart of our company. Inspired by the recent boom of food truck culture,
our new company, La Fille Du Laitier, wants to develop the first Canadian
Theatre Foodtruck. 
Where other
entrepreneurs have developed projects like a mobile library truck, or a mobile Laundromat
for the homeless, La Fille Du Laitier envisions a foodtruck that will open and
transform into a full stage.
Recent graduates
of the Ecole Nationale de Theatre in Montreal, LFDL presents professional
quality theatre to those who don’t necessarily get out to see it, inviting
spectators to experience plays during a picnic, in an alleyway near their home,
or during festivals or block parties
THE TRUCK
Our truck is an old volounteer ambulance, measuring 22 feet; it has six
wheels and beeps when you back up. It’s a big job. 
It’s got a good heart and a good motor and we’re ready to jump to the
transformation process, but we need support!
We’ve teamed up with Big Dog gripping, a company working with vehicle
transformation for stunts in films. They’ve estimated the job to cost between
10,000$ and 15,000$, to cover everything from adding sound systems, lighting
systems, and to organize the basic mechanics of cutting a side of the truck to
open and close for performances. 
Our financial goal for this part of our development is to hit our
15,000$ mark, to cover these first costs! 
WHERE WE’RE AT
La Fille Du Laitier is Caroline Bélanger, Marie-Hélène Bélanger and Jon
Lachlan Stewart, all recent graduates of the National Theatre school of Canada.
With a long background in theatre arts, experimental theatre creation,
playwriting, and touring in outdoor theatre, this company is inventif, talented
and commited to this vision. 
The main obstacle we face with our project is beginning. This is a large
investment, and we’re just learning the ropes in terms of engineering and
mechanics! But the Theatre Foodtruck is at the spirit of the origins of
Theatre, even back to Shakespeare: a live performance, free for all, in the
heart of each community. We feel that this is a project with a huge cause and
huge drive!
Do you believe in
seeing theatre delivery shows, in your backyard, or in your favourite public
hangout? 
Do you believe in
accessible and affordable entertainment for everyone!
Are you interested
in supporting the emerging theatre scene in Canada?
Help us build our
Theatre Foodtruck!! We promise, if you help us reach our goals, you’ll be
seeing us on your corner soon.

story:
Help grow Apple Village Arts!

Hello! 

I am Jeanne LaVallee, the Founder and Director of Apple Village Arts, a non-profit Afterschool Studio Art Program for children in the East Village.  I am a professional Artist, Writer, a licensed Educator with three decades of teaching experience. AVA is a lean operation with one employee and a small board of trustees.  I write to present this campaign to grow Apple Village Arts, which has been serving children in the Lower East Side since the Spring of 2010.

Any funds you may offer for AVA will be used for one or more of the following:

●rental of studio space

●art supplies

●employee salary and health insurance 

●course tuition aid

●art show expenses (hardware, catering services)

●daily snack

●occasional museum admissions fees

Perks: 

$50 donation: Hand silk-screened AVA (or other design) tee shirt.

$100 donation:  Complimentary Studio Art Class (for a child, ages 4 to 12).

$500 or more donation:  Original watercolor painting or print by Jeanne LaVallee.

AVA has been offering affordable studio art instruction for children, ages 4 to 12, in the East Village for over four years.  And each year, AVA—in conjunction with the local café, Ciao for Now—has presented a children’s art show during the first month of Spring.  This year, AVA will hold an additional exhibition in the Fall, in celebration of Hallowe’en.

The mission of AVA is manifold:

•to expand children’s visual vocabulary by studying shape, line, color and positive and negative space, and how these elements interact with each other to affect our senses;  •to teach Composition and Design techniques;  •to teach techniques in the following genres: Portraiture, Landscape Painting, Figure Drawing, Abstraction, Still Life Drawing/Painting, Drawing from (some) Nature, Collage, Papier Mâché, and Bookmaking; •to expose students to a variety of art-making media:  pencil, charcoal, pastel, pen & ink, colored pencil, crayon, watercolor, tempera, acrylics, silk screen, as well as scissors, glue, yarn, string;

•to allow students’ dreams to become realized; •to develop appreciation for the works of both the Masters and one’s classmates made in many different styles; •to empower students by offering them a place to exhibit (and possibly sell) their work.

Risks and challenges:

Without financial stability, the challenges involved in operating an afterschool art progam are many; though the primary challenge is to secure affordable and suitable studio space in the East Village, as the rental fees are prohibitive.  Your support would allow that security of knowing that AVA would be able to meet this challenge.

Other Ways to Contribute:

If you are not able to contribute funds, there are some other ways that you can help AVA:

•Donate ART SUPPLIES:  paper (all types), paints (tempera, acrylic, watercolor), canvas or canvas boards, brushes, ink, pencils, markers, colored pencils, crayons.

•Donate SNACK items:  crackers, corn chips, fruit, etc.  No sugar, please.

•Offer a WORKSHOP:  if you are a Visual Artist, come to the Studio for an afterschool class to offer instruction or do a demonstration for AVA Students.

•Offer your space/ VENUE for a children’s art exhibit.

story:
Project statement

My name is Renata Machýčková, I am visual artist and art director of a new gallery project, that I want to implement in the center of Bergamo in Italy.

Goal of Lab Gallery is to support young and emerging artists and bring to the city a new artistic vibrancy and potential. Through regular presentations, exhibitions and publishing to allow young artists and students of art schools the opportunity to promote a functioning art market and thus contribute to their independent professional development. Another motivation is to establish contacts with artists and designers from abroad and apply their work in the new environment.

The gallery opening will be a clear example of collaboration between artists and students from art and design field. Moreover they will be able to participate at the gallery space with their own visual contents. We hope to have many exhibitions and events in this space! Your contribution goes towards building a foundation for an ongoing, artistic endeavor. We aim to exhibit new and exciting work, arrange panel discussions, invite guest curators and other. So help us to open our doors as soon as possible!

Our Building

Via Torquato Tasso is a location in center of Bergamo, where we would like this activity commence. The start-up costs for the first  exhibition will be at least €7000. This is only a percentage of the total cost involved in opening the space, but with your help we can have our first show by this spring. 
Below, there is a budget outlining the expenses that will be covered with your help. The listed items are to help us prepare the space for the first show. Like painting walls, lighting, new floor, furniture and money for the marketing and promotional materials.
Budget for the first opening:

ITEM

NEEDED

Security deposit 1st month of rent

1900

Painting walls

180

Installation of lighting

2184

New floor

433

Furniture (desks,chairs,storage cabinet,pedestals)

745

Projector, cabels

264

Marketing (posters,invitations,web)

280

Transport of art from Czech Republic

875

Ceremony of the opening

250

TOTAL

€7111

    



 




    

Entrance to gallery from the main street  


Support to open a space and contribute to Bergamo's art scene

Main motivation of Lab Gallery is bring to the city something new and fresh. Create a solid background for czech art and design in Italy and also disseminate awareness about it in new environment.  Please help support Lab Gallery's ever strengthening programming and my commitment to providing artists with opportunities to experiment and receive a degree of financial compensation for their work.

 Benefits & Gifts for Your Help

for your support you will get an original artworks by young artists or designers from Czech Republic, which will be presented at Lab Gallery. Let's invest to art!  

     

Porcelain rings by Zuzana Holanova, collection for Shit Happens, Czech Republic  

      

Porcelain plates with cobalt handmade drawing by Martina Zilova, Czech Republic


Digital print on canvas by Jan Paravan, Night Dive, 2014, Czech Republic


Digital print on canvas by Jan Paravan, Night Dive, 2015, Czech Republic


Porcelain necklace by Zuzana Holanova, Czech Republic


Photography prints by Viki Kollerova, Slovakia 


Calendar of artworks by Renata Machyckova, Czech Republic


Jewelry by Hanus Lamr, Czech Republic


Jewelry by Marketa Podana Janku, Czech Republic



Pink Lipstick, Ludmila Smejkalova, Czech Republic

Other perks you can see on Facebook.


Other Ways You Can Help

Contribute to this campaign, get some great thank you gifts and help to gallery become more visible! Share this campaigne on social networks, "like" our Facebook page and post about us. 

 Hopefully with your help, we'll be able to make this a reality and you'll always be welcome to come down and see us at LAB GALLERY! 

T H A N K   Y O U

story:
(*Découvrez notre projet en Français ci-dessous... )


As Terre-Happy Artists, we believe …

Awakening’s Art sustains the birth of a Happy World …

Its real mission is to allow to feel without limits, and  to invite everyone to express oneSelf through simplicity, colors, matters, waves of energy and sounds, …

The Awakening’s Art is the  action of painting, built on  breathing, meditation and connection to the source.

As Terre-Happy Artists, we feel that “Awakening’s Art”  is the emerging artistic wave in the history of Art ; it brings us innovative ways of expressing Beauty...


The Awakening’s Art Concept

The concept repose upon 3 aspects :

* Cro-creation of energetic artworks, with energetic effects on people & places !!  They bring Presence, Inner Joy & Inspiration whole day long ! 

* Co-creation of energetic intuitive artworks, using specific colors & matters and playing with waves of energy & sounds as a new way of expressing Beauty. Awakening's artworks can be created by everyone, everywhere, regardless of artistic experience ... ! 

* Eco-friendly approach, by the use of local art supplies, natural paintings &  matters from the Nature...


Why do we need your support ?

We are going to expand this emerging artistic movement all over the world, starting from New York, through the participation at ArtExpo NY (April 23rd-26th).

* by creating a structure and an official website to sustain the emergence of the Awakening's Art.

* by creating a Network where everyone can learn to become an Awakening's Artist.

* by producing energetic awakening's artworks.

* by creating Happenings “your Awakening Wish” at ArtExpo NY: artworks with personnalized colors and matters will be created during live performances at the booth.

Therefore we need a minimum $ 6,300- budget to be present at the ArtExpo NY on April, 23rd-April, 26th 2015.

This includes the cost of the booth, the travelling costs, the art supplies, the 'happenings' material, the promotion material, & the development of the internet site www.awakeningsart.com.

This is our first step ...

And after that, we will go further with our dream-project :


Which is our dream-project ?

Our dream is to develop an International Network of Awakening's Artists to allow everyone in the world to express one’s creativity, become the creator of one’s life, and benefit from energetic Awakening’s Artworks.

* by promoting the emergence of Awakening’s Art as the next artistic movement in the history of Art, an innovative way of expressing Beauty in all its dimensions.

* by creating a International Awakening’s Artists Academy

* by creating energetic Awakening’s Kits

*by giving access to on-line Awakening’s Art workshops

* by promoting Awakening’s Artworks


Who are we ?

Christine Neve & Isabelle Flahaut - TERRE-HAPPY artists® Founders

Christine and Isabelle have been researching and teaching energetic & awakening's art for 15 years.
Christine, as energetic  life-coach & artist, and Isabelle, as healing art-therapist & artist, have both inspired thousands of adults & children to express their full creative potentials.
As Terre-Happy artists, they now share their large experience  of Co-creative Awakening's Art. 
They come to the evidence that creativity combined with the energy of a sacred space &  an open heart is the source of  Inner Joy, Inspiration & Presence.
Inspired from Land-Art,  Action painting and Visionary Art,  the Awakening's Art is the emerging artistic movement needed to create a New World.

Will you be part of the Awakening's motion ?



Awakening's Art®(Art de l’Eveil)

En tant que Terre-Happy Artists, nous rêvons d'un Nouveau Monde...

Awakening’s Art®  est la vague artistique qui permet l'émergence du monde dont nous rêvons… le nouveau courant artistique de l’Histoire de l’Art !

Sa vocation est de permettre de ressentir sans limite par la connexion de l’Etre à son Essence … pour devenir un Humain au cœur éveillé ! Elle invite chacun à S'exprimer  … en toute simplicité, par les couleurs, les matières, l’énergétique, les vibrations sonores et  la connexion à la Nature.

En pratique, Awakening’s Art® est l’action artistique basée sur la respiration, la méditation et la connexion à l’ « Essence-Ciel ».

Awakening’s Art®est une vague d’expression énergétique, moteur du processus de changement et de libération de l’individu et donc de son éveil.

C’est une invitation à ressentir, à se transformer, à se connecter avec la force de Vie.

Le concept repose sur 3 piliers :

* La Co-création d'oeuvres énergétiques, ayant des effets sur les personnes et les lieux !  Ces œuvres diffusent  Présence, Joie & Inspiration.

* La Co-création d'oeuvres intuitives, en 'jouant' avec des vagues d'énergie, des sons, des couleurs et matières naturelles. Ces oeuvres peuvent être créées par toute personne connectée à son Essence, en tout lieu et même sans expérience artistique ... ! 

* Approche Ecologique, par l'utilisation de matières trouvées dans la Nature et de peinture naturelles.

Pourquoir avons-nous besoin de votre support ? 

Nous souhaitons permettre à ce mouvement artistique émergent de se développer partout dans le monde, en commençant par New York en  le diffusant à ArtExpo NY (23-26 Avril 2015).

* en créant une structure et un site web officiel.

* en créant un réseau social où chacun peut apprendre à réaliser des oeuvres énergétiques. 

* en créant des oeuvres énergétiques.

* en organisant des " Happenings " à ArtExpo NY: la réalisation d'oeuvres énergétiques personnalisées...

Cette première étape représente un budget de minimum $ 6,300- 

Cela comprend le coût du lieu d'exposition,  de voyage et transport des oeuvres, les fournitures artistiques, le matériel de promotion (brochures) et le développement du site internet  www.awakeningsart.com.

Qui sommes-nous ?

Christine Neve & Isabelle Flahaut - Fondatrices

Christine and Isabelle ont réalisé des recherches et ont enseigné l'Energétique et l'Art de l'Eveil pendant près de 15 années.
Christine, en tant que  Life-coach énergétique & Artiste, et Isabelle, en tant qu'Art-thérapeute & Artiste,  ont inspiré des milliers d'adultes et d'enfants à exprimer leurs plein potentiel de création.

Elles sont arrivées à l' évidence que la créativité combinée à l'énergie d'un espace sacré et d'un coeur éveillé est la source de Joie, Inspiration et Présence en ce monde.

Inspiré du 'Land-Art',  de l''Action painting' et de l'Art Visionnaire, l'Awakening's Art correspond à la vague artistique émergente nécessaire à la création d'un Nouveau Monde ...



Participerez-vous à ce mouvement d'Eveil ?

transformer, à se connecter avec la force de Vie.
Le concept repose sur 3 piliers :
* La Co-création d'oeuvres énergétiques, ayant des effets sur les personnes et les lieux !  Ces œuvres diffusent  Présence, Joie & Inspiration.

* La Co-création d'oeuvres intuitives, en 'jouant' avec des vagues d'énergie, des sons, des couleurs et matières naturelles. Ces oeuvres peuvent être créées par toute personne connectée à son Essence, en tout lieu et même sans expérience artistique ... ! 
* Approche Ecologique, par l'utilisation de matières trouvées dans la Nature et de peinture naturelles.
Pourquoir avons-nous besoin de votre support ? 
Nous souhaitons permettre à ce mouvement artistique émergent de se développer partout dans le monde, en commençant par New York en  le diffusant à ArtExpo NY (23-26 Avril 2015).
* en créant une structure et un site web officiel.
* en créant un réseau social où chacun peut apprendre à réaliser des oeuvres énergétiques. 
* en créant des oeuvres énergétiques.
* en organisant des " Happenings " à ArtExpo NY: la réalisation d'oeuvres énergétiques personnalisées...

Cette première étape représente un budget de minimum $ 6,300- 
Cela comprend le coût du lieu d'exposition,  de voyage et transport des oeuvres, les fournitures artistiques, le matériel de promotion (brochures) et le développement du site internet  www.awakeningsart.com.


Qui sommes-nous ?


Christine Neve & Isabelle Flahaut - FondatricesChristine and Isabelle ont réalisé des recherches et ont enseigné l'Energétique et l'Art de l'Eveil pendant près de 15 années.

Christine, en tant que  Life-coach énergétique & Artiste, et Isabelle, en tant qu'Art-thérapeute & Artiste,  ont inspiré des milliers d'adultes et d'enfants à exprimer leurs plein potentiel de création.

Elles sont arrivées à l' évidence que la créativité combinée à l'énergie d'un espace sacré et d'un coeur éveillé est la source de Joie, Inspiration et Présence en ce monde.
Inspiré du 'Land-Art',  de l''Action painting' et de l'Art Visionnaire, l'Awakening's Art correspond à la vague artistique émergente nécessaire à la création d'un Nouveau Monde ...





Participerez-vous à ce mouvement d'Eveil ?

story:
Short Summary

Palestinian hospitals are full of seriously ill children!

Red Noses Clowndoctors Palestine, a non-profit charitable foundation, has been bringing these children joy and laughter on a regular basis for almost 5 years.

Now, we are running out of funding.

Now, we need your help to continue these regular visits.

You can bring smiles to seriously ill Palestinian children by pledging 5$ today.

Yes, just 5$ can improve the quality of life of hospitalized children in Palestine!

Please find it in your heart to help NOW! Together let us raise 10,000 USD to secure the program until the end of the year.

For more information on Red Noses Clowndoctors Palestine: http://www.rednosespalestine.com

Thank you for your generous contribution.





About us:

RED NOSES has been working since 2005 in a region of the world where laughter is unexpected, but desperately needed: in Palestine. It started as a pilot project and became a regular programme in 2012. In the local hospitals, the emotional support provided to patients unfortunately often lags far behind basic medical care. In addition, relatives are often unable to regularly visit their family members in hospital due to the restrictions to the freedom of movement. A visit from RED NOSES clowns greatly helps to improve the emotional state of patients and is often able to convey to children a sense of security and joy of life. The apolitical and non-religious stance of the clown character makes it possible for clowning to help immensely, especially for children, in overcoming fear and trauma. Like all other RED NOSES clowns, the clown doctors in Palestine attended many workshops, where they were trained as experts in hospital clowning. Through their efforts, the young artists now have a regular source of income.

Teamwork, creativity, motivation, self-assurance and, not least, the enriching feeling of being able to give something back to their society, strengthen the self-confidence of the clown doctors The therapeutic clown is dedicated to developing and promoting practical and productive coping strategies in the health environment by concentrating on the scientifically proven health benefits of humour. When clowns work with patients, they take their individual needs and interests into consideration. This results in a special connection between patient and artist. The patient’s response is an elevation of mood coupled with laughter. Laughter - a profound key to regaining balance and being able to cope. The simple sound of laughter ringing out with joy and vitality is a signal of hope – all over the world.

"As a young, female artist I have a regular source of income and I am enriched by the feeling of being able to give something back to society." - Christine Hodali, Palestinian actress and RED NOSES Clown


An array of laughter studies show that laughter releases endorphins and therefore has a positive effect on the general well-being, strengthening the immune system and the psyche, easing pain and tightening social bonds. This requires from the professional “clowndoctor” a special sense of compassion, sensitivity, intuition. Their skills for situational awareness and improvisation must be expertly fine-tuned.

RED NOSES Palestine (RNPS) was created as a branch office to the RED NOSES international (RNI)in Vienna, it was created as the first experience for the organization to the middle east because of the big need for its intervention and activities in the Palestinians Hospitals where children are traumatized and health care services are in big need for development and improvement. RED NOSES Palestine is working in five Palestinian hospitals, Alia Hospital – Hebron, The Huda Al Masri Pediatric Cancer Dept. – Beit Jala, Agusta Victoria Hospital – East Jerusalem, Palestinian Medical Complex – Ramallah, and An Najah National University Hospital – Nablus.


RED NOSES Palestine is planning to target all Palestinian hospitals including in Gaza where the need is bigger.

General Objectives: The empowerment of patients in hospital with coping strategies to better deal with their personal situation in hospital thereby minimizing their stress levels during hospitalization are our main concerns. The concept of therapeutic clowning is very effective as the clowns are specialists for regaining childlike vitality and for assuming a positive attitude in a conflict situation. 


“for 40 days Kawthar didn’t have any verbal interaction with anyone, but today after the clowns came in she was interacting with them”  her mother said.

Kawthar 3 years old is one of the children RNPS visits regularly at The Huda Al Masri Pediatric Cancer Dept. in Biet Jalla hospital, in one of the visits Kawthar had the first verbal interaction during RED NOSES Palestine Clown Doctors team visit to the department.


Targeted group: the project aims at targeting the Palestinian children (especially traumatized) in the Palestinian hospitals. In the first phase, the project targets hospitals in five Palestinian cities; East Jerusalem, Ramallah, Bethlehem, Nablus, Hebron. The clowns organize two visits per week for each hospital. reaching 11,000 sick children each year and more than 11,000 adults between parents and medical staff, through RED NOSES Palestine "Clowndoctors" visits. 

What We Need

We need 10,000 USD to secure the hospital visits until the end of the year in the 5 hospitals we currently working in.

story:
Who am I?

Hello I am Chris Mosley,  a senior studying Scientific Glass Technology at Salem Community College.  Salem offers the only degree program for Scientific Glass in the country. Upon completion I will receive an Associates Degree in Applied Science. Since I started blowing glass in 2011 the equipment and studio was always rented. I have not had the means to own my equipment or have a space to create with glass. Even when given space in a friends garage I still had to borrow tools and equipment.  Also I was limited in time to use the space due to having to wait till my friend was at home to have access. 
When I  graduate in May 2016 I  will no longer have access to the college facilities and equipment. I  have been successful in getting orders that need to be fulfilled.  However,  I  will need to have a space and equipment of my own to create my Glassworks . I'm ready to devote full time on my own.

With your support I will be able to run my own flame working studio. Your contribution will allow me to have equipment,  supplies and space needed for a full time studio.

 

Me making my first cup when I was apprenticing, back in Sept 2011 in Atlanta. 

What I Need 

I am looking to raise $6,500
  • Flameworking torch: To melt the glass. Ranging price from $1,000-1,700 plus shipping.


  •  Kiln: To anneal the glass, or slowly cool down the glass to remove all stress. Ranging from $1,500-2,500 plus shipping 

  • Ventilation: To remove all toxic gases and material that are in the studio. Ranging from $400-1,000 

  • Smith Hand Torch: To melt glass on a smaller scale. Ranging from $130-150

 

Torch Accessories to hooking everything up :

  • Hoses for my torch: Ranging from $25-55
  • Connections Valves: Ranging from $20-70/ea (depending on quick connects or regular). 
  • Flash Back Arrestors: Ranging from $70/set
  • Regulators: Ranging from $72-210/ea
  • Rental of Oxygen and Propane: Ranging $40-140 depending what size tank and the provider/per fill up.

  • Glass: I will be ordering color, and clear glass rods. I will also be using different size glass tubes to create the hallow structures.
  • The Space: The current place I'm living in Salem, New Jersey has an area that I will be able to set up a small studio that is part of my rent. However when I graduate I would like to move into a commercial space because of marketing and flexibility purposes, plus it's just more professional.  Rent of a commercial space ranging from $400-850/mo.
  • The rest:  The funds will be used to build my bench and  other stands and shelves to keep my studio organized and properly setup in order to be able to work efficiently. So wood, metal, screws and hinges plus others will have to be bought.

The Perks and rewards for helping fund this project

First off each piece of art will be created by me and only me. Each one will have it's own unique personality to it. I will be using borosilicate glass to make all my items. I am not a production artist, it's more about being able to create quality, unique art work for those who enjoy hand crafted objects. Each piece will not look like the next and I will make sure each one has it's own personality but still look like the pictures presented below. 

1. Mozeart Designz Sticker: est size 3x4 in. 10 + shipping

Designed by Chris Mosley, Illustrated by Brian Prince.

2. Implosion Pendant: est. size .5x1 in. $30 + shipping

You can pick from dot implosion (on left) or frit implosion (on right). Colors will be listed. 

3. Mens/Women glass Cufflinks: est. size 12mm. $50/pair + shipping




4. Phoenix Pendants: est. size 5x4 in. $60 + shipping

You will be able to pick two colors and loop style (showing in bottom right and top right) to make your own unique hand crafted Phoenix. 

5. Glass Spiders: est. size 3x3 in. $75 + shipping 

You will be able to pick two different colors to custom create your spider.

6. Pocket Monster: est. size fits in hand nicely. $200 + shipping (smoking functional) I will also throw in a Mozeart Designz Sticker


You will be able to choose from one color (on left) or two color not shown) or frit which is a striking color, meaning it changes colors depending on the amount of heat I put on it (on right). This item is super customizable. 

7. Inner Fire (Neon structure): est. size 18x9 in. $500 + shipping I will also include any perk 1-5 and a Mozeart Design Sticker


This piece interacts with your bodies energy field and your touch. 

8. Custom Order for your birthday and Christmas, two orders a year for 3 years + any perk 1-6 or under $200. This Perk is $1,000 + shipping
  • Starting in 2016-2019 I will make you one custom object of your choice within my skill level for your birthday and Christmas for the next 3 years. 
  • You also get to pick one perk under $200 on the list above.
  • Lets create something cool together.

Contact me

I'm an artist to the fullest and I just like making cool things people enjoy. So please contact me if you see something you like but might want to change the color, or just want it to look kinda different. I am a very versatile person and I am willing to work with you on your unique piece. None of the design are set in stone so feel free to ask question about any of the perks. The better the communication the better your perk is going to look when it show up to your home. 

If I don't reach my goal

I will continue using my school facilities and renting time at others studios. But no matter what I get i'm still going to spend the money on flameworking equipment and make all of the people who helped fund this project items. Glass is my life so i'm going to always keep moving forward with this medium. I've had to hustle my whole life and nothing is going to stop me from my dreams. 

The Impact

With your help I will be able to become self employed and start my own studio. I believe Americans creating small businesses in arts and craft is a real positive moment in this country and in the world in general. I will be able to share my passion to others, maybe even one day down the road, be able to teach small classes to our youth and start a art school. 

I think this is the path to rebuild this economy, skilled people becoming entrepreneur and sharing their craft with the people who appreciated hand crafted goods and them having a real producer, customer relationship and working together. 

Risks & Challenges

Everything is ready to go, I have the space and i'm blowing glass everyday at school. I just need to order the equipment and can start filling orders and move into the next stage of my life. I've already spend countless funds on classes at crafts schools and will be getting my degree in May for glass. It's time for a change and make a living doing something I love. I've had to hustle and work really hard to just make it this far and I'm sure more obstacles will continue. I wouldn't trade this life for anything else, I love blowing glass and can easily see myself doing this until I grow old and would love to pass this ancient old trade down to my children whenever I have any.   


Other Ways You Can Help

Please follow me on 

Instagram: https://instagram.com/mozeart/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Moze01

Twitter: https://twitter.com/MoZeArT

My Website: http://mozeart.com/


Special Thanks

Brett May for shooting and editing the video: http://www.eschermedia.com/
Brian Prince for the Mozeart Designz Sticker: http://www.baprince.com/
Matt Janke for using his hotshop: http://www.jankestudios.com/
Lance and Maureen for using their flame studio: https://www.flametreeglass.com/
The Goat Farm Art Center for letting me do my interview there: https://www.facebook.com/TheGoatFarmArtsCenter

story:
Please help me bring Venezuelan Artists to Trinidad & Tobago for an Art Exchange Project: 

The Travelling Shoe Project/ Proyecto Zapato Viajero

I began this project in 2011 when I made an open call to collect shoes in Trindad & Tobago to carry to Venezuela. On arriving there I left the shoes in the care of Eliseo Solís Mora. He used the shoes to participate in the Velada de Santa Lucia- Art Festival  (http://www.velada-santa-lucia.com/) and then they were shown in Hamburg, Germany as part of the Velada- Remix festival. Finally it is time that the project can return to Trinidad!

Eliseo Solís Mora  is the first artist who will be making the trip to Trinidad & Tobago for this project. He will be staying here for approximately three weeks. During this period he would participate in various art events with the main event being the continuation of the Travelling Shoe Project/ Proyecto Zapato Viajero (http://zapatoviajero-travellingshoe.blogspot.com/)

About the Project: 

We have all been historically affected by migration and each in different ways. In the Caribbean migration is deeply rooted in our history with loss, displacement, trauma, violence and in modern times it is marred by longing for either 'a better life' or 'origin'. I am interested in doing this project between Ve + TT specifically to demystify perceived distance and difference. Our proximity is very close and there is frequent migration (mostly Venezuelans) yet the average person knows very little about the other country. With this project people are invited to share their shoes as artifacts of experience/ statements of where they have been and where they are going thus sharing movement and 'walking in each other's shoes...' to get a better understanding of each other. All actions will be documented online, http://zapatoviajero-travellingshoe.blogspot.com

BUDGET

Airfare - 350.00 USD

Accommodation - 300.00 USD

Food - 100.00 USD

Materials - 60.00 USD

Ground Transportation - 40.00 USD


I have already saved 350 USd to help offset costs of airfare. The political situation is very chaotic right now in Venezuela so I am doing my best not only to see this project reach the next stage but also to practice precisely what it is about- building support + linkages between both countries.

I am hoping this can develop in to an Artist Residency Programme to further encourage artistic exchange between both countries. 

  • For two countries as geographically close as they are we remain strangers to one another, partly because of the language barrier  

For more information

  • You can like the page on Facebook here - https://www.facebook.com/Proyecto-Zapato-Viajero-Travelling-Shoe-Project-252505118164460/?fref=ts and check out the blog too - http://zapatoviajero-travellingshoe.blogspot.com

Velada de Santa Lucia- Art Festival  (http://www.velada-santa-lucia.com/)
and then they were shown in Hamburg, Germany as part of the Velada- Remix
festival. Finally it is time that the project can return to Trinidad!Eliseo Solís Mora  is the first artist who will be making the trip to Trinidad & Tobago for this project. He will be staying here for approximately three weeks. During this period he would
participate in various art events with the main event being the continuation of
the Travelling Shoe Project/ Proyecto Zapato Viajero (http://zapatoviajero-travellingshoe.blogspot.com/)


About the Project: 
We
have all been historically affected by migration and each in different ways. In the Caribbean migration is deeply rooted in our history with loss, displacement, trauma, violence and in modern times it is marred by longing for either 'a better life' or 'origin'. I am interested in doing this project between Ve + TT specifically to demystify perceived distance and difference. Our proximity is very close and there is frequent migration (mostly Venezuelans) yet the average person knows very little about the other country. With this project people are invited to share their shoes as artifacts of experience/ statements of where they have been and where they are going thus sharing movement and 'walking in each other's shoes...' to get a better understanding of each other. All actions will be documented online, http://zapatoviajero-travellingshoe.blogspot.com
BUDGET
Airfare - 350.00 USD
Accommodation - 300.00 USD
Food - 100.00 USD
Materials - 60.00 USD
Ground Transportation - 40.00 USD
I have already saved 350 USd to help offset costs of airfare. The political situation is very chaotic right now in Venezuela so I am doing my best not only to see this project reach the next stage but also to practice precisely what it is about- building support + linkages between both countries.


    I am hoping this can develop in to an Artist Residency Programme to further encourage artistic exchange between both countries.   For two countries as geographically close as they are we remain strangers to one another, partly because of the language barrier  


    For more information  You can like the page on Facebook here - https://www.facebook.com/Proyecto-Zapato-Viajero-Travelling-Shoe-Project-252505118164460/?fref=ts and check out the blog too - http://zapatoviajero-travellingshoe.blogspot.com
campaign_city: port of spain, Trinidad and Tobago

story:
In celebration of the five year anniversary of the first Twitch Bob Ross marathon, they will once again run an eight day long “The Joy of Painting” marathon starting October 29! The marathon and our campaign extension will run until November 5.

Minnetrista has something special planned for when we meet the $25,000 mark – all fans who make a donation, from $5 to $2,500, will be included in the “Fan Brush Club” in the Bob Ross Experience. We will create a “TV Guide” to be included in the late 80’s living room, and ALL donors will be included as a “Fan of Bob Ross.” Help bring Bob home to the WIPB TV Studio where it all started, and be remembered as a fan (brush) of Bob Ross. All fans that claim a perk with the Limited Edition T-shirt will receive free admission to the Bob Ross Experience from October 29, 2020 - October 29, 2021 when wearing the shirt.  (*Update - Unfortunately, we did not make our mark of $25,000 so these additional perks were not earned.)

Bob Ross inspired generations of viewers with only his soft-spoken voice and a pallet knife. His message of  compassion creativity continues to reverberate today. And yet there is currently no place fans of Bob Ross can visit to celebrate and honor Bob’s life and legacy. With your help, we are going to change that.

With its global impact, it’s hard to imagine that much of the beloved series, The Joy of Painting, was filmed in the unassuming WIPB studio in Muncie, Indiana. Bob painted for the iconic series out of the historic L.L. Ball home on Minnetrista’s campus from 1983 to 1988. The message Bob promoted of fearless creativity and the need to reinterpret perceived mistakes as “happy little accidents” is something we want to see further amplified in the world today.

The Bob Ross Experience at Minnetrista will create a space for Bob’s message to flourish. It will showcase his life and work, allowing visitors to stand in the exact studio where he painted. 

Our goal is to raise $200,000 to renovate the original WIPB studio space. This will include needed repairs to the house and construction of the studio itself. We already have Bob’s stuff - his easel, palette, brushes that we will combine with other objects and media from Bob’s life and career to bring "The Joy of Painting” to life

Check out our giving tiers to see the perks available for helping to make the Bob Ross Experience a reality!

When you enter the former studio, the magic of Bob’s presence and message can still be felt. We want to make that space accessible to everyone. Minnetrista is partnering with Bob Ross Inc. to create a permanent experience that consists of a recreated studio, gallery space, and painting workshop. Through The Bob Ross Experience we will reframe how people think about their mistakes, abilities, and self-expression. We want to say to the world: Bob painted here and you can too.

No gift is too small. Every contribution brings us closer to realizing a permanent space where Bob’s message and work can flourish and continue impacting lives. Another way to help make The Bob Ross Experience a reality is to help us get the word out! Use the Indiegogo share tools to let others know about the campaign. Let’s work together to celebrate Bob Ross and everything he stands for.

Thanks to Buckle-Down, David Arquette, Hulu, Olaes Enterprises, Trends International, LLC, and Twitch.TV for their generous donations to this campaign. Special thanks to the past and present staff of WIPB for sharing their memories and expertise and to Bob Ross Inc. whose support makes this project possible.

story:
For more information on the fair and Corporate Sponsorship opportunities log on to our website - www.artftlauderdale.com/partners

 

2018 Art Fort Lauderdale Preview On Deco Drive (WSVN-7)

 

Summary

We are the Co-Founders and Creators of Art Fort Lauderdale - "The Art Fair On The Water". Living in the great city of Fort Lauderdale, we've traditionally been in the shadows of Miami when it comes to arts & culture, often times forcing us to drive to our neighboring county to the south for "cool things to do". After creating the Choose954 social movement in an effort to Cultivate Culture & Community in the Greater Fort Lauderdale area, we wanted to start filling the voids in what we felt was missing in our community from a cultural perspective. 

These voids in arts and culture as affected our community in many ways, from the issues of attracting and retaining top talented in the form of skilled workers, to having opportunities in our creative economy for artists to survive. As a result, this has also driven our local artists & creatives to travel or relocate elsewhere to sell and display their work in an effort to continue pursuing their craft. 

With our city absent of having a major four day art fair (the prevalent global format for art fairs), we wanted to create a super unique experience to put our community on the map as a unique destination to view & interact with art while creating a platform to highlight our talented local artists & creatives.  We are dedicated throughout the year of working to highlight the arts & culture through our Choose954 movement and our other initiatives in an effort to make the Greater Fort Lauderdale area a better place to live, and not just a better place to vacation, because we live here too. Arts & Culture is more than just the play component of "Live, Work, Play", and art fairs are more than just another excuse to get outside of one's house to walk around and peruse through art they normally don't get to see in one confined setting. Art Fairs promote diversity, they bring neighbors into dialogue, they increase creativity, and they offer opportunities for civic pride. Ultimately, we need help from the community to produce this event as art festivals are not inexpensive to produce, and with the help not coming from the business community up until this point, we're turning to the Indiegogo Community and philanthropists alike to help us grow and scale this endeavor.

 

The Fair

So what does this look like? This experience is framed within the context of a 4-day curated art fair that transports attendees on a journey along the famed Intracoastal waterways via water taxi with stops at vacant luxury waterfront properties that feature emerging artists exhibiting various styles and methods of art that reflect the past, the present and the future. 
 
This destination art fair seeks to highlight the uniqueness of the city and put Fort Lauderdale on the art world map as a premiere location to view, interact with and purchase art along with giving art aficionados, residents and visitors a cultural experience that is memorable, interactive and engaging.

Viewing art inside confined spaces like convention centers and under tents have become more of a purely commercial and transactional environment that lacks memorable experiences and is void of opportunities for thought, reflection and contemplation.

Art Fort Lauderdale features independent artists and galleries displaying paintings, sculptures, installations, photographs, films and editioned works of the highest quality at each of the waterfront homes/pavilions.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Ultimately, we need monetary support to be able to produce the event. From logistical expenses in the form of the boats we use, to hiring security and cleaning crews, to ticketing systems - it costs money to make events happen. Last year our production costs tallied up to just over $100,000 and that was with us being conservative on our advertising & marketing budgets. We need support to help us with production costs, getting the word out through marketing, and being able to add integral pieces we feel will help bring the fair to the next level like bringing in performance artists and interactive components.

We've created unique perks for you the supporter to have an even more unique experience in return for your support. From exclusive access to previews to limited edition t-shirts to meet & greets with the artists, we're glad to help connect you to parts of an art fair you might not have ever experienced otherwise in exchange for your support!

Even if we don't meet our very modest and reasonable goal, we're masters of making a lot out of a little and will still use every dollar wisely to help us bring the fair to the next level.

 

The Impact

The Recent Arts & Economic Prosperity 5 Report provided evidence that the non-profit arts and culture sector is a significant industry in Broward County—one that generates $414.2 million in total economic activity. This spending —$148.5 million by non-profit arts and cultural organizations and an additional $265.7 million in event - related spending by their audiences—supports 11,078 fulltime equivalent jobs, generates $268.9 million in household income to local residents, and delivers $40.1 million in local and state government revenue. This economic impact study sends a strong signal that when we support the arts, we not only enhance our quality of life, but we also invest in Broward County’s economic well - being.

With Art Fort Lauderdale being the grandest event of the year culturally for Fort Lauderdale, it serves not only as a catalyst for growth & new ideas, but for economic impact. The week of Art Basel ("Miami Art Week") generates over $550m in economic impact for one week into their local economy, with Broward County reporting $414m in total economic activity absent a major four day art fair.

More over, with the minimal barrier to entry we have for local artists to get involved and exhibit, this has created a unique opportunity for artists to showcase their work in ways they've never showcased before, leading to fostering new collectors and sales. Multiple exhibiting artists who frequently thousands to exhibit in Miami without generating sales were pleased to share with us that they preferred our format at a fraction of the cost while generating sales to new collectors. Having grown the fair from 700 attendees the first year to 2000 attendees in our second year, we're excited to have more people get to know about Art Fort Lauderdale so we can make an even greater impact in our community and the art world. Ultimately, we're just trying to make our community a better place to live and create more opportunities for our artists, if you share our vision we'd love to connect with you and discuss further!

 

e-mail - evans@artftlauderdale.com

Website - www.artftlauderdale.com

Instagram - www.instagram.com/artftlauderdale

Facebook - www.facebook.com/artftlauderdale

story:
Hi, I'm Lee Bradley a freelance comic book artist from the UK. I've been working as a full time professional artist for the last 14 years. I had my big break working on the 'How to Draw Guide' in the UK Transformers Universe comic. I went on to work on the comic strips in Transformers Universe & Transformers Animated, TMNT Fast Forward & Spider-Man for the European Market. As well as other comic titles I have worked on a variety of sketch card properties from Marvel to Star Wars and I now work within the wider art world producing artwork for companies and exhibitions.

This book collects all my work together in one place from my 2017 'Retro Kids Cartoons' exhibition, which was funded by the Arts Council England. This book also includes never seen before artwork related to the exhibition.

Within this sketch book, I am going to show not only the finished images from my exhibition but also the process of how I produce my work. From the initial design concepts, through the penciling and inking stages with descriptions of how I come up with my ideas. Which will serve as an insight to how I produce my work.

As a kid, and to be honest as an adult cartoons have always been a big part of my life. One of my fondest memories was getting home after school looking forwards to watching some of my favourite characters on their adventures. Be it wondering wether the adventurers would ever get home in Dungeons & Dragons, or if one of Megatron's plans would ever come to fruition. These cartoons opened a portal to another world where you could either identify with or fantasize about being part of the adventure. Sure, some were time fillers, some cartoons you would watch whilst waiting for your most prized heroes and villains to get their air time. This art book is not only a chance to view my processes but also to be transported back to those experiences and for me to share my exhibition with a wider audience. This book will give me the opportunity to share my memories of watching these cartoons with inside trivia about the characters, air dates and format through scheduled TV. Where we uniquely got to share our communal upbringing  through watching cartoons, throughout the 1980's.

To get this book in production I am asking for your help to reach the goal of £1500 to be able to get a print run produced so I can share my artwork with you in a readable high quality format. If I could reach 100 backers that each had a copy of the book in their hands that would be amazing. As this would fund the cost of production. I've created the art tiers as a help to reach the funding goal incase we fall short. Without your help this book won't reach production so every pledge counts in helping us reach our goal.

I have set up a number of tiers to suit every budget. You can support this campaign to bring this book to life from the basic package of a signed copy of the book at just £15. I hope there are enough options to excite everyone!.

 

The 1st Tier is a signed copy of the book. After that there are options to add a high quality A3 textured Archival Print of either the Heroes or the Villains of 1980s popular culture. There is a third option where you can add both to your order.

If you are one of the people that love to own original art, there are several options.

You can get a choice of Exclusive Head sketches within your own copy of the book. There are 5 options to choose from in the drop down menu.

1. Optimus,

2. Megatron

3. Mumm-Ra

4. Skeletor

5. TMNT

Once I reach capacity this option will be closed.

There are also upgrade tiers available to own art that appears within the book! Keep checking back as I will update these graphics to show which ones are still available.

If you pick any of the artwork from the original ART tiers you will also receive a signed copy of the art book & both 'Retro Heroes' & 'Retro Villains' A3 art prints will be included with your order.

The IMPORTANT NOTE- All Artwork will be packaged securely with your book purchase and posted out securely together.  This is to save you money on postage increases.

The A2 original 'Retro Villains' art is a UK Exclusive & will be posted out separately.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Nicole Bishopp and I have been designing for 6 years.  In that time frame I have successfully created my own brand and product line which I currently sell online.  
  • For the past 2 years it has been a dream of mine to attend Surtex in NYC to get my designs out to major retailers and manufactures
  • With your help this will be a dream come true and propel my designs to the next level.

What I Need and What You Get

  • My costs for the Surtex show: 
    Booth: $5,000  Travel: $3,000  Marketing:$1,000  Supplies: $1,000
  • Perks to you: I added a range of perks for your contribution on the right hand side and in addition to the perks I will be highlighting all off you that donated in my follow up video of the show.
  • I will also be throwing a huge party for anyone that donates and can attend once I'm back from the show.  TBA

The Impact

Your contribution means the world to me! I have worked so hard the past 6 years to get to this point and I know in my heart this is the path I must take.  I have never been so sure in my life! 

The Plan

  • I will be creating 60-100 designs (6 categories total) which will take me 5 months to complete. 
  • Photoshoot for the models wearing my products for PR/Marketing.  
  • Get all designs into digital format for online viewing
  • Email all potential buyers prior to the show and follow up after

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize some of you can't contribute so please help me by sharing my campaign with all your friends and family!  Sharing alone helps tremendously.  Use the Indiegogo sharing tools for easy sharing!

story:
Self-Care and Art

 For my exhibition at Anchorlight in Raleigh, North Carolina, I will show 40 of my drawings, which are a reflection of the way art has served as my self-care. My art practice has been an integral way in which I have worked through trauma in my life.  In addition, I will offer free self-care programming:

  • Yoga and self-care workshop, offered by 500-hour certified yoga instructor Brye Senor
  • Art therapy workshop lead by licensed art therapist Natalia Torres Del Valle

While everyone is welcome to the free workshops, I plan to reach out to LGBTQ folx, people of color, and women. As a queer woman with a trans partner, I know that every day can be a struggle in a world that devalues you. I want to help offer rejuvenating experiences to people who are particularly affected by the political climate we live in. 

The Money

I will use the campaign funds for:

  • Paying the instructors
  • Purchasing supplies for the workshops
  • Framing the drawings 

In return, for as little as $10, you will receive one-of-a-kind artwork. 

The Impact

I hope that this is a launching pad for a whole series of work around self-care, and your contribution can help make this a reality. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially, please share this campaign with 5 people who will find it meaningful

story:
Short Summary

Your contribution will go to make a lost artist, Sotha’s dream come big. There are three things that’s going to happen after funded:

  • Building a place where Sotha will be able to move from the street to there, his street coffee will be moving there also.
  • Building an art space provided to Kids in the village (About 100 kids will benefit and allow then to access to creativity activity). There will be monthly small contribution fees from parent for kids to access to the class for art material and maintenance the space.
  • There will be an art workshop and exhibit provided to arts fellow comes to make and display their work.
  • The rest of the fund will go to build the second floor space and art material for kids in the village.

 

 

We are building art space for the community

The Impact

Sotha is an artist. He finished 9th grade from Public school and start to learn art with an NGO called Campey. He then started to make a living in art by drawing on wall for shops, coffee, hotel, pagoda and restaurant. At nighttime, he gathered his friends and rent a small spot to do portrait drawing for people in the night market.

Helping the community 

In the meantime, he helped others who need help. He stared in several film of Davy Chou, a French filmmaker. Below was one of the short films. He learns how to use camera and start to help people filming their film and videos.

Cambodia 2099 (2014)

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm6529186/

Golden Slumbers (2011)

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2087847/

 

Sotha's side job

Art in Cambodia is one of the careers that don’t have appreciation or value. His work in arts, drawing didn’t generate enough income for his living. The same thing happened to his entire art fellow, and they all started to abundant art. He got married in 2017 and making a stable income becomes the main priority. He opened a small coffee shop on the street in 2018 and spend most of this time their to sell coffee. Since then he less and less time to draw and doing art.

He dreams to have his own space to do art and generate a stable income. He would turn it into an art hub for his friends and started to make income for them by giving art class to kids in the community, sell coffee and sell his own artworks there.

August of 2019, he met me, a friend who want to make his dream happen and find a small land and looking for some money for him to continue. He design his dream art studio and willing to start to build it soon. He and his friend manage to raise fund about 5500$ but it is not enough to build the first floor.

We are looking for fund of 3000$ to be able to finish the first floor, move his coffee and start to do his art work there.

Your contribution will go to make his small dream come big. There are three thing that’s going to happen after funded:

  • Building a place where Sotha will be able to move from the street to there, his street coffee now will be moving there also.
  • Building an art space provided to Kids in the village (About 100 kids will benefit). It’s a monthly small fees for kids to access to the class for art material and maintenance the space.
  • There will be an art workshop provided to art fellow comes to make and display their work.
  • The rest of the fund will go to build the second floor space and art material for kids in the village.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

To friend, and contribute and share this to people who could help. For people who could send him via ABA please do:

ABA NUMBER: 000320037

Name : KUN SOTHA

Follow us on our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/1960arts-coffee-108745230564192/

SCREENSHOT ? AND DM ⌨️ THAT YOU GOT IT <3 ❤️

⚠️DONATING IS NOT PREORDERING⚠️ 

❇️?DOXA WORLD?❇️

@doxawrld ♻️ @mandikarwhite ♻️

? STATEMENT OF DOXA ? 

DOXA​~
Our ​purpose​ is to unite the world through knowledge. ​DOXA​ creates a healthy society
for active creative communities and an equal platform for all.
Launched in 2019, ​DOXA​ captures the unique cultural spirit and youthful rage of Columbus. D​ OXA​ is a representation of the diversity that has defined the city's cultural landscape. Both minimal and complex, D​ OXA​ depicts the developing knowledge and imagination of the current age. Through study and culture, D​ OXA​ has created a lifestyle brand that is for the next generation of wave makers.
The image of ​DOXA​ is defined by the influx of self awareness expressed through multimedia and pop culture. Growing up we all have chosen which people or movements inspire us. Through understanding and study we’ve grown as a society inspired by those who’ve come before us. ​DOXA​ seeks to inspire those who come after us, by acknowledging the paradigm shift and giving a platform for young creatives all over the world.
