story:
Hi Every Backers:

A greatest news from us today. We have got a great support from a man(We call Mr. V) , Now we  can give a better offer to backers.

--------------

Hi the first 3 backers, 

Thanks for your first support.

We also give a discount to you and let you have a double pairs of skirt.

--------------

WE love miniature figures. WE wish to give them a new look. WE want to make them a new skirt.

After numerous testing and discussion, WE did it! “Minifreinds skirt” finally comes out a fantastic prototype …

NEED A NEW LOOK FOR YOUR FIGURES?

“Minifriends skirt” now can help. No fear of any damage to your original figures and with repeated replacement, you can easily did it – a new skirt is all need!

 “Minifriends skirt” is designed to address the TWO main problems with the current system.

1. Same height of the existing figure.

2. Feel natural with the existing figure.

What does the package include ?

1. Skirt

2. Waist

At this stage, we can offer three colors for “Minifriends skirt”: 

1. Grey

2. Dark blue

3. White  

WANT more colors?? 

That is our dream too, come join us, let make this out, with more funding, we can have pink, red, black, light flesh and more.

==========================

Minifriends® (MiniF) is a division of Friends Fun Limitada

LEGO® is a trademark of the LEGO® Group of companies which does not sponsor, authorize or endorse this site

All trademarks belong to their respective owners.


Risks and challenges

This will be our first  project and we continue to master our manufacturing . The unpredictable factors, as usual, are possible shipping or manufacturing delays from our factory or unexpected production issues.

INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING NOTICE!

We love our International customers. We use tracking to make sure your package is scanned and heading out on the right boat but after that it is the responsibility of Postage services that don't provide tracking. If you wish, you can pay for a form of Premium tracked shipping at an additional cost ( where available ).

We will be regularly updating our campaign information and are always reachable via our customer support at : 

minifriendsmo@gmail.com

story:
Art, Science, nature, sacred geometry. 2500 Years of history in the palm of your hand. Solid polyhedrons in brass and bronze that emerge from the fire.

We have travelled over 2,500 years to bring Platonics to the present. Works of art emerged from fire and cast in solid brass and bronze.

More perfect, beautiful and elegant than ever.

You may not know what Platonic solids are, but will definitely be able to recognize them. They are the only five regular polyhedrons that exist and owe their name to the great Greek philosopher Plato, who was fascinated by their beauty and the mystery of their forms.

Some of the most important geniuses of mankind were seduced by their perfection and purity. From mathematicians, such as Pythagoras, or philosophers, as Aristotle and Plato, to artists, such as Leonardo da Vinci, Escher and Dali. Beyond the borders of mathematics, they are present in Art, life and nature.

In a technological world where everything is cloned and mass-manufactured, we sometimes forget the beauty of craftsmanship and the taste for detail. We have committed ourselves to a craft where each piece is cast using ancient techniques, and therefore unique. For this reason we want to invite you all to feel a simple and tangible experience, both genuine and pure.

  • You want to have the coolest totem. 
  • You love Art and Design. 
  • You're a creative person seeking a source of inspiration. 
  •  If you are looking for something surprising and unique to add to your collection of objects. 
  • You're someone who values craftsmanship and uniqueness. 
  • You want to have the ultimate collectors addiction 
  •  If you crazy for Philosophy, History and Mathematics. 
  • You are a metal junkie and need a centerpiece for your collection. 
  • You love geometric shapes and their beauty. 
  • You admire the works of Leonardo Da Vinci or Dali. 
  • You’re looking for a personal and original gift with history. 
  • If you are looking for the coolest artefact to decorate your office or home - the ultímate conversation starter. 
  • You want to have over 2,500 years of history in the palm of your hand.

Those who love art, design, history, philosophy, science, innovation, metallurgy, or beauty things. The collectors, and people who love craftsmanship and uniqueness and the most ancient and primitive techniques. People who love bronze and brass pieces made by cast.  

Those creative people who seek a source of inspiration like Design Professionals, Artists, Mathematicians, Scientists, Professors, innovators, Polyhedras Enthusiast, Architecst, Writers, Engineers, Programmers, Metal Junkies, Collectors, Decorators and more!!!

Before launching these pieces of art we have spent several months studying the best way to reproduce platonic solids. We finally decided to work with one of the most ancient techniques, smelting. We value quality work and an interest in details.

Based on drawings and ancient literature over 2500 years old, and thanks to modern technology, we were able to make the first figures we would use as molds with a 3D printer. After trying with different sizes and materials we have achieved the perfect combination.

All our solids are cast in the traditional way. We use high-quality brass and bronze cast at over 600 degrees, then shaped and individually hand polished. Each piece is unique. Each figure is meticulously checked to verify its quality. In addition, each polyhedron or set has a serial number.

We believe in the preservation of craftsmanship as a key to enrichment of our society.

Thanks to Platonics you can enjoy a piece of History, from a single figure to a complete set. Five Platonic solids, available in two different sizes and five finishes.

There may be slight variations in size and weight due to the crafting process. Each piece is unique.  

2,54 cm = 1 in

100 gr = 3,5274 on

  • If you want 1 solid: Choose your favourite solid, the size and finish that suits you best. 
  • If you want a Platonics Set of five: choose the size and finish you like best. 

For those who want a complete set, we have designed an elegant base on which Platonics look like a work of Art. As it could not be otherwise, we have chosen one of the noblest materials: wood. In clear beech wood and Walnut varnish to highlight the tonality of bronze and brass. Platonics Base is free for all backers that buy a set!!!

Find your combination in our rewards, we have also included several add-ons to complete your selection and for the most demanding do not hesitate to contact us, we will help you to customize your reward.


To add an add-on simply you have to contact us before select your perk. Due to the addicional weigth we have to calculate the total shipping costs. You have to tell us the perk and the add-on you wish. We want to give you the best price.

With our offer, you have to select the perk and enter in the “Additional Gift” option the amount until the total price of our offer. ( Just make sure that it adds up correctly) 

You can get as many add-ons as you would like.  

Once the campaign is over you will get a survey where we will make note of your options.

---------------------------------------------------------------------

Visit our website at PlatonicsLand.com for more details and some cool photographs! Feel free to follow us on our social medias for some more fun stuff as the project progresses!

We love hearing from our backers! Send us an email to platonicsland@gmail.com or message us on IndieGoGo.

We hope we can count on your help to make Platonics a reality and share with all of you this experience.  

Thanks for Reading!
story_txt:
Art, Science, nature, sacred geometry. 2500 Years of history in the palm of your hand. Solid polyhedrons in brass and bronze that emerge from the fire.We have travelled over 2,500 years to bring Platonics to the present. Works of art emerged from fire and cast in solid brass and bronze.More perfect, beautiful and elegant than ever.You may not know what Platonic solids are, but will definitely be able to recognize them. They are the only five regular polyhedrons that exist and owe their name to the great Greek philosopher Plato, who was fascinated by their beauty and the mystery of their forms.Some of the most important geniuses of mankind were seduced by their perfection and purity. From mathematicians, such as Pythagoras, or philosophers, as Aristotle and Plato, to artists, such as Leonardo da Vinci, Escher and Dali. Beyond the borders of mathematics, they are present in Art, life and nature.In a technological world where everything is cloned and mass-manufactured, we sometimes forget the beauty of craftsmanship and the taste for detail. We have committed ourselves to a craft where each piece is cast using ancient techniques, and therefore unique. For this reason we want to invite you all to feel a simple and tangible experience, both genuine and pure.

story:
FesteVivas

En la República Dominicana las estatuas vivas son cada vez más visibles, gracias a la multiplicidad que ha generado la incidencia de FESTEVIVAS, que está integrado dos componentes:
1. "Festival Internacional de Estatuas Vivas", es un evento único en toda la cuenca del Caribe. Es un proyecto de arte público que celebramos en RD desde el 2009, desde entonces anualmente abrimos la convocatoria para que artistas del estatuismo de todas partes del mundo participen con propuestas de calidad y que transmitan un claro mensaje en su contenido.

2. "Taller Dilatación del Cuerpo Inteligente, Monumentos Humanos", una herramienta que permite mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas (niños, jóvenes y adultos) que se benefician con el aprendizaje de esta técnica. 
 OBJETIVOS: 

    1. Promover el arte público como una forma de cuidar y dar buen uso a los espacios de la comunidad, utilizando el teatro imagen como punto de atracción.

    2. Multiplicar esta disciplina impartiendo talleres, y beneficiar así, mediante la gestión e inclusión, a nuevos integrantes al proyecto.

    3. Reconocer la calidad, el compromiso y el respeto con el que los artistas que participan en el Festival presentan sus obras de arte.

    LA PROGRAMACIÓN DEL EVENTO ESTÁ EN:  http://festevivas.blogspot.com/

 Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes 

  • Nuestra meta es de RD$200,000.00 (doscientos mil pesos dominicanos) para destinar:  - El 50% (cien mil pesos dominicanos) a la entrega de premios de las mejores propuestas que resulten ganadoras y el 50% restante para la realización de 2 talleres para 20 participantes, con materiales de maquillaje y montaje para muestra de resultado incluidos. 
  • Como regalo y/o souvenir, te será entregado un TShirt temático del evento.
  • Estamos contando con tu sensibilidad para la realización de este tipo de actividades, que reducen el ocio y promueven el arte para buen uso de los espacios públicos. ¡Forma parte del cambio!
    •  
    Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
 Si no puedes colaborar, eso no significa que no puedas ayudar: 
  • Comparte este link con tus amigos y así sumas posibles aportaciones.

story:
We are the Contemporary Art department in an art high school in Etobicoke, Ontario, Canada.

We have worked incredibly hard for the past seven years to build something we are all very proud of - something widely considered to be among the best in the world.  We are asking for your help because we have exceeded our ability to support our students' continued growth.

Every year we host representatives from art schools across the globe who fly in from countries such as Hong Kong, Scotland, France and the USA to recruit our students who curate their work in solo exhibitions throughout our school.  Reps and students engage in conversations that can last up to an hour in length, during which the work is critiqued and relationships are formed that assist the student throughout the application process.  Our students will apply to as many as 18 schools in their pursuit of the best opportunities.  Portfolio Day at  

Portfolio Day at ESA is the culmination of years of focused effort and the opportunity for our students to speak one-on-one with representatives from dozens of schools from around the world.  Relationships initiated on Portfolio Day allow our students to achieve the very highest scholarships for their post-secondary education.

PD6 included 110 representatives from 55 post-secondary schools from 3 continents and resulted in more than four million dollars in scholarship offers.  PD7 will be even bigger.  In 2014 we had 55 participating students, in 2015 we had 71 students involved, and next year we have more than 90 students in PD7.  In order to make this sustainable we need your help.

We are planning to raise at least $20000 with this campaign.  With that money we will be able to pay for the extraordinary work being planned by our current grade 11's.  Ninety five participants with between 15 and 50 works each means that we will have 2500+ pieces finished by October 28.  Some things are inexpensive to make for sure but others are elaborate and complex.  Even at $30 per work it would cost 3-4 times what we are asking to pay for the portfolio content.  

One reason for making such large and elaborate things is that we really do see a direct translation to scholarships.  Even with the most significant offers most of our grade 12's are unable to afford attending international programs, and so we do everything we can to secure the funding required for their dreams to come true.  In the six years of Portfolio Day at ESA we have received approximately twenty million dollars in total scholarship offers.

Next year, for the second time, participants in Portfolio Day will come from all six arts majors at ESA.  By taking on responsibility for all of these futures we are also helping to shape aspects of our culture.  PD6 reached a level of complexity and scale that exceeded our limits.  With PD7 larger in every way, with an almost doubling of the number of participants in two years, we are accepting a responsibility that will require the support of a much larger community - one in which you can play a valuable role.

All of the money raised will go to support our kids in PD7.  Your contribution will allow us to re-imagine what is possible at high school.  We hope you will attend PD7 when it opens to the public at 7pm on Friday October 28, 2016.

You can support us by contributing to this campaign, by spreading the world about our fundraising efforts, and by following us on Instagram at esa_visual_art and esa__photography

Tax Receipts will be issued for all donations over $25

Thank you!

story:
My name is Bethany Rusen. I am an artist, writer, educator, dog mom to two black greyhounds and West Philadelphia resident. 

I'm excited to be opening a new coworking space for ceramic artists in West Philadelphia called Black Hound Clay Studio. BHCS will allow clay artists of every stripe to have an affordable place to make their work 24/7, whether they are a beginner just starting out, a serious hobbyist with a day job or a student newly graduated from one of the area's many art schools.

      

   

(in the studio throwing pots, and during my residency at the University of Delaware)

I have been working seriously in clay since I was 14. I completed a BFA and MFA in Ceramic Sculpture. Working as an artist, technician and teacher, I realized that what I valued most was creating community and mentoring those who are coming up as artists. It is the thing that I love the most and the thing that gets me out of bed in the morning. 

BHCS is an idea that has been waiting in the wings for a long time while I searched for a suitable space. That search came to an end at the beginning of February when a couple of friends let me know that the space at 711 South 50th Street had just come available. It was perfect: my favorite part of my favorite neighborhood, close by to many thriving business, directly accessible to public transit, as well as having a large, open concept and lovely outdoor space.

No dream this ambitious can be realized by one person, which is why you find yourself on this page. I hope you'll read my story and consider contributing to help make Black Hound Clay Studio a reality.

What The Studio Needs 

The start up costs for the studio are considerable. BHCS will have everything for a clay artist to make their work; that means pottery wheels, kilns, a slab roller and an extruder will need to be purchased. Also needed are things like plumbing for sinks and electrical and ventilation for the kilns.  There are a lot of miscellaneous costs as well, everything from copier paper to hiring an accountant. 

We had a successful fundraising raffle held at Art Star Gallery and Boutique on March 12. This effort raised almost $1500 and really cemented my faith in the arts community to support a venture as big as this one.

BHCS was also lucky enough to secure a loan from Philadelphia Federal Credit Union (a great institution a stone's throw from the studio!) that will cover the deposit and first few months' rent for the space as well preliminary work done to the floors and walls (which is currently under way). The funds raised here on Indiegogo will go toward the equipment and outfitting of the studio. 

That's where you come in!

The gods of free craigslist stuff have smiled upon me and I've collected many things already, including work tables, shelving and storage. I currently have four working pottery wheels, most of which were donated by friends and family or bought used. BHCS is well on its way.

The total amount we would like to raise is $10,000. To give an idea of the costs, here is a short list of some of the larger items we still need to purchase:

  • Skutt KM-1027 Kiln: $2200
  • Furniture Kit and Envirovent for kiln: $755
  • North Star 24" Slab Roller: $815
  • North Star Extruder: $309.50
  • Stools for wheels and work tables: $285
  • plumbing hookup for sink: $500
  • Linoleum for floors: $1400

A full, exhaustive list of everything needed is available, just ask!

In keeping with my philosophy of creative reuse, used and recycled items will be purchased whenever possible. 

If the full amount of $10,000 isn't met, it'll simply be a matter of prioritizing what equipment is purchased. Essential things will be purchased first. It's the intention that, as the studio progresses, equipment will be added and the space will continue to be improved.


What You Get

  


We have some great perks to thank you for your generosity. In addition to launching Black Hound Clay Studio, I am a potter. My company is named Stanley Chester & Albert Ceramics. If you choose to contribute to the campaign, you could get a little piece of SC&A, everything from magnets to bowls to mugs to vases. 

There will also be a chance for you to have an inscription of your choice on dedication tiles that will hang in the studio.

There are also some fun experiences to be had, including a clay workshop with yours truly and 8 of your closest friends, and a chance to rent space on BHCS' enormous outdoor patio.
The Impact

Affordable studio space (indeed, any studio space at all) is increasingly at a premium in the city of Philadelphia. This is a problem in many cities as urban real estate prices continue to rise and artists are priced out of long held spaces. I watched this happen to my friends when I lived in New Bedford, Massachusetts, and when the studio building at 915 Spring Garden Street here in Philly closed this past summer.

I am hoping that BHCS will allow clay artists of any and every stripe to have an affordable place to make their work 24/7, whether they are a beginner just starting out, a serious hobbyist with a day job or a student newly graduated from one of the area's many art schools. When I graduated from Tyler School of Art in 2003, I was lucky enough to find such a space at a converted carriage house in Elkins Park, and it allowed me to continue the progress I had while in school. I would like to provide such a space to others and pay it forward.

BHCS will be located in my neighborhood, West Philadelphia, right off Cedar Park at 50th Street and Baltimore Avenue. This area is home to many established and up and coming business, including Dock Street Brewery, Little Baby's Ice Cream, Greensgrow West, VIX Emporium, Firehouse Bicycles, Satellite Cafe, Cedar Park Cafe, Mariposa Food Co-op, Amari's, Snapdragon Flowers and Talking Headz Hair Salon. I am really excited to be a part of this growing business community and to continue to add value and increase artist involvement in the neighborhood.

Risks & Challenges

In many ways, I feel as though I have been preparing for a moment like this for many years. Opening Black Hound Clay Studio will truly be a dream come true for me.

My practical experience includes 6 years of running clay studios. I began as an undergrad at Tyler School of Art mixing clay and glazes for the studio, and from there moved on coordinating work study students at the studio at UMass Dartmouth while I was a graduate student. For the last four years, I have been the ceramics technician at Main Line Art Center in Haverford, which includes running a studio used by 150+ students each semester, as well as developing and implementing programming for the studio. In addition to my technical experience, I have developed a successful pottery business called Stanley Chester & Albert, which is currently in its third year. 

There are many risks inherent in a project this large, but my wide ranging experience as a studio technician will help me rise to the challenges of starting a business like BHCS. I think the single biggest factor in my success is this: I know tons of talented, hardworking, dedicated people who I am lucky enough to call my friends, supporters and colleagues. I am damn lucky to be a part of this community in the city of Philadelphia, and I am hoping BHCS will only strengthen that community.


And Finally:

Please share this widely. It can really only become a reality if many people are invested in helping it succeed.

The space is currently under renovation and nearing completion. A lot of work is needed in the interior, including tearing up carpet, painting walls and laying a new floor, and most of May will be spent completing these tasks. You can see the progress for yourself at http://blackhoundclay.com/blog. You can also find us on Facebook and Instagram. If you are local to Philadelphia and want to help (or just come by to see the space in progress!), please email me at bethany@blackhoundclay.com. 

THANK YOU ALL!

There will also be a chance for you to have an inscription of your choice on dedication tiles that will hang in the studio.
There are also some fun experiences to be had, including a clay workshop with yours truly and 8 of your closest friends, and a chance to rent space on BHCS' enormous outdoor patio.



The Impact


Affordable studio space (indeed, any studio space at all) is increasingly at a premium in the city of Philadelphia. This is a problem in many cities as urban real estate prices continue to rise and artists are priced out of long held spaces. I watched this happen to my friends when I lived in New Bedford, Massachusetts, and when the studio building at 915 Spring Garden Street here in Philly closed this past summer.
I am hoping that BHCS will allow clay artists of any and every stripe to have an affordable place to make their work 24/7, whether they are a beginner just starting out, a serious hobbyist with a day job or a student newly graduated from one of the area's many art schools. When I graduated from Tyler School of Art in 2003, I was lucky enough to find such a space at a converted carriage house in Elkins Park, and it allowed me to continue the progress I had while in school. I would like to provide such a space to others and pay it forward.



BHCS will be located in my neighborhood, West Philadelphia, right off Cedar Park at 50th Street and Baltimore Avenue. This area is home to many established and up and coming business, including Dock Street Brewery, Little Baby's Ice Cream, Greensgrow West, VIX Emporium, Firehouse Bicycles, Satellite Cafe, Cedar Park Cafe, Mariposa Food Co-op, Amari's, Snapdragon Flowers and Talking Headz Hair Salon. I am really excited to be a part of this growing business community and to continue to add value and increase artist involvement in the neighborhood.

Risks & Challenges

 In many ways, I feel as though I have been preparing for a moment like this for many years. Opening Black Hound Clay Studio will truly be a dream come true for me.
My practical experience includes 6 years of running clay studios. I began as an undergrad at Tyler School of Art mixing clay and glazes for the studio, and from there moved on coordinating work study students at the studio at UMass Dartmouth while I was a graduate student. For the last four years, I have been the ceramics technician at Main Line Art Center in Haverford, which includes running a studio used by 150+ students each semester, as well as developing and implementing programming for the studio. In addition to my technical experience, I have developed a successful pottery business called Stanley Chester & Albert, which is currently in its third year. 
There are many risks inherent in a project this large, but my wide ranging experience as a studio technician will help me rise to the challenges of starting a business like BHCS. I think the single biggest factor in my success is this: I know tons of talented, hardworking, dedicated people who I am lucky enough to call my friends, supporters and colleagues. I am damn lucky to be a part of this community in the city of Philadelphia, and I am hoping BHCS will only strengthen that community.


And Finally:
Please share this widely. It can really only become a reality if many people are invested in helping it succeed.
The space is currently under renovation and nearing completion. A lot of work is needed in the interior, including tearing up carpet, painting walls and laying a new floor, and most of May will be spent completing these tasks. You can see the progress for yourself at http://blackhoundclay.com/blog. You can also find us on Facebook and Instagram. If you are local to Philadelphia and want to help (or just come by to see the space in progress!), please email me at bethany@blackhoundclay.com. 
THANK YOU ALL!

story:
Funding Part 2!

Thanks to everyone that contributed to part 1 of 'Ham Fisted Half Cocked'. The pre-orders for the book paid for the materials needed for the exhibition with a good chunk of the initial print run paid off. The book should be printed and ready around the end of May or shortly after.

Why are you doing another indiegogo?

The initial campaign did it's job but I've had a lot of people enquire about pre-orders since that campaign closed so this is your chance to pre-order the book if you haven't already to guarantee yourself a book as son as they're ready and also give you access to the perks available in part 1 - signed books, printed thanks, limited edition prints, badges etc.
Here's the info as it was in part 1......

Ham Fisted, Half Cocked Book & Exhibition

What is a retrospective and what life does an artwork have once exhibited and it's purpose served?

I'm raising funds for a 'retrospective' book and exhibition of my recent work, to be shown initially at Back Lane West in Redruth. Its not going to be a formal, bland, retrospective but more an exploration int
o the life of artwork after it has been shown and what becomes of it. The exhibition will feature new and old work formed into a new installation exploring the idea of what happens to old work. 

The book itself will document the exhibition itself as well as featuring archive images of a selection of my previous exhibitions and artworks - giving them a way to live-on. 

The exhibition will be the first part, opening 14th April this year with the book to follow soon after. (End of May)

For an idea of the work to be included see some of my portfolio of previous work here

What I Need & What You Get

I raised the necessary funds in part 1 to fund the first run of books and the help towards the additional materials and costs needed for the exhibition. The books and other perks are being pre-sold through this platform are pre-orders of the book. the more orders I get the more i can get printed!

The Book

A cloth bound, professionally produced artist 'retrospective' book to go alongside the exhibition (although published later) featuring quality colour images and text.

  • Grey, perfect bound, hardback, cloth cover (similar to image but this may very)
  • Minimum of 40 pages but final number may vary
  • It will feature what I see as my best and most successful works over the last few years as well as new work, older pieces, unseen work and models/sketches.
  • There will also be images from the exhibition as well as accompanying texts.

The Exhibition (Funded and opening soon)

A tongue in cheek exploration of my artistic journey so far to feature a new sculptural installation. The installation will expand into the space evoking ideas of something between a storage system for used and new/unfinished work and a chaotic theatre set. It will both seek to celebrate and commiserate the pieces within and their varying successes whilst giving them a new life after death.
The phrases Ham Fisted and Half Cocked suggest a clumsy, or not fully committed attempt at something; perhaps my own opinions of my artistic journey thus far or perhaps a reference to the nature of retrospective shows themselves.  

The exhibition will be a temporary event based show featuring an opening night and weekend with the work evolving in the space over the preceding week.

Any backing would be greatly appreciated! Thanks!

story:
Photos:  above, Jay Paul, below, Alistair Palmer (Quote by Rollo May)

Hello friends, family, and art lovers,


If there are any artists in your life, you may understand that making art is not necessarily a choice for them.  Artists have a need to create. It occupies their imagination, their hearts, and their daily life constantly.  And they need 3 things in place in order to manifest creation:  time, space, and money.  


I’ve been offered a residency in Auvillar, France this summer, and this Indiegogo campaign will help me take advantage of this wonderful and important opportunity. I have never been to France and I am excited to see how this new country, landscape, and culture will reveal itself in my paintings!


Almost 4 years ago I moved to San Miguel de Allende, Mexico, where I work as a teacher and have a studio.  I know for certain that living in a different country, within a different culture, has changed my work.


Recently, I have been working on a series of drawings inspired by the intersection between different biology and anatomy systems.  A gallery here in San Miguel is interested in giving me an exhibition in the fall and this residency will go a long way to making that happen.


If you have ever admired, been transformed or have had your senses delighted by a piece of art, then you have benefitted from an artist’s creativity. I truly believe that art is what helps us to connect to each other and to the natural world.  


I appreciate your support in helping me explore my artistic passion in Auvillar, France. I have already secured some of the money that I need for the trip, and I am asking for your help to cover expenses such as flight, ground transportation, residency fees, food and ultimately framing costs for drawings.




 

For your generous donation, I have assembled lots of different perks that I hope will bring you some pleasure.

Part of what I do is to paint mandalas.  This work is different and apart from my other paintings, but nevertheless, just as important to me. I have created public and private mural commissions of mandalas here in San Miguel hoping to leave a mark of beauty for years to come.  I am offering here, mandala designs in the form of note cards, silver and resin jewelry and limited edition Giclee prints

Photo:  Ginger Bandoni

Photo:  Todd McIntosh


Residency time is like gold to artists.  I have attended several in my life over the years, and to have that uninterrupted time has been as rewarding as anything I have done in my many years of art practice.  I hope you will help me to realize that time once again in France.  The residency in Auvillar- Le Moulin a Nef- is affiliated with the Virginia Center for Creative Arts in Amherst, Virginia where I have been a fellow twice.  Here are a couple of pictures of the beautiful residence situated near the Garonne River.

The medieval town of Auvillar which is located in the mid-Pyrenees in the southwest is considered one of France's most beautiful villages and is also a stop on the road to Santiago de Compostela.

You can see and read more about the residency here if you like.


To create something that has never been and could never have been experienced by anyone else renders the art process magical. To be “in” that magical space of experience and to come out of it with something to give to the world is both the artist’s gift and reward.

Thank you so much for helping me to manifest that gift!

If you feel that you cannot contribute monetarily at his time, it would help greatly just to share this campaign with anyone who you think might.

Here are images of the perks I am offering:

Mandala cards, from my original paintings (designs chosen for you)

Mandala Magnetic Bookmarks (design chosen for you)

Photo:  Luis Leura Matamoros
Mandala Pendant in Silver and Resin

Photo:  Luis Leura Matamoros
Here is a video of the making of this mandala here
Limited Edition Giclee Print: (one design example) Please visit here to see the rest of the mandala designs

Photo:  Ri Anderson
One of a Kind Drawing 10" x 9"  (one example) ink, watercolor, prismacolor, pastel on paper.

Photo: Ri Anderson
I invite you to have a look at my website to view more of my work.

Photo: Malula Sanchez
Cheers!
Linda

story:
I have been accepted to participate in a month-long workshop in the Carrara region of Italy where I will learn classical marble carving methods by realizing a sculpture with the help of a CNC robot. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to combine the state of the art robot milling technology that I have been working with here with the experience of hand finishing a marble work. I will meet artists from around the world and be guided by world-class craftsmen. The Digital Stone Project is a unique experience that will allow me to realize a difficult work, network with artists and learn a variety of skills. 
As many of you know, I am an artist and MFA candidate at William Paterson University. Through the Digital Stone Project workshop, I will be able to expand my experience with digital sculpture techniques and stone carving. It's an invaluable opportunity to combine my interests!
http://www.digitalstoneproject.com/

What We Need & What You Get

This program runs from June 4th to July 3rd, and is all inclusive. The total amount for me to participate in this program will be approximately $7526.35, including travel.  I have applied for and been awarded scholarships from Autodesk and The Center for New Art, and am looking for additional support to help make this happen.  
I am offering a variety of my original sculptures from the Venus series as well as some hand carved stone works as perks for donations. 
And just for reading you get a free video of me dancing like a looney!!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Γεια σας! Hello! My name is Heather Berthelette and I am a fine artist from southeastern Massachusetts. I believe that if you can dream of something, then you can achieve it. That's why I have never stopped creating and learning at any opportunity I could get, since my graduation from the University of Massachusetts Dartmouth in 2012. With a BFA degree under my belt, I have continued to thirst for more knowledge and understanding of our world and it's many cultures and ideas through my art.  

During this past year, I stumbled upon the Greek language and began to teach myself, along with joining a small study group. I am now in two Greek classes a week and have been told I am doing pretty well for a non-Greek! I explore the ancient Greek and Roman art exhibitions all along the East Coast, gaining what lessons I can derive from them and drawing these ideas in my sketchbook. Even my local Greek community has invited me into their church, festivities, and holidays, in which I have gladly taken part of. All of this has been preparing me for what I know I am meant to do: travel to Greece and paint it's story. 

In the midst of all of my studies, I was excited to learn of my acceptance to the Hellenic International Studies in the Arts (HISA) on the island of Paros, Greece. As a continuing education student, I will study for three months on the islands as well as the mainland, sketching and painting as I go. I can finally immerse myself in what I have been preparing for! Any and all contributions will go directly towards funding my education at HISA, a brand new series of work, and the opportunity to have my paintings shown abroad to fresh audiences. 

What I Need & What You Get

All of the funds raised are going directly towards my three-month semester abroad at the Hellenic International Studies in the Arts (HISA). This includes:

- Tuition

- Air fare

- Art supplies for courses

- Living essentials

I have already received two small scholarships from HISA for my studies. Because I am a continuing education student and already hold my bachelor's degree, they were able to drop the tuition by $1,500. For another subtraction of $500, I will be completing a work study on the island of Paros for a few hours a week outside the studio. All together, they have given me $2,000 off, but I still need your help to get there!

I believe in the balance of giving and receiving. With each donation I receive, I would like to give back with the gift of art! I will be sending signed prints and greeting cards, original mini paintings, and even some Greek-inspired creations to all who are able to financially support my dream! (Please view the "perks" section of my campaign page.)

If by chance I do not reach my entire goal, all of the funds raised will still be applied to a solo art trip. The length of the painting expedition will depend upon the total amount received. I am determined to create and show a series of work on my travels and, one way or another, I will achieve this dream, whether I am able to study at HISA or not!

The Impact

The world has been filled with much disruption and negativity, which many people choose to focus on. There's also a lot of change going on in Greece right now. To me, I see this as a perfect opportunity to raise more awareness of all the beauty that is in this world, which is often overshadowed by outside events. This is a time of awakening and truly seeing, and supporting the arts can help us all do just that! 

I have already personally experienced the impact art can have on viewers. In 2015, I journeyed to England and created a series of work based on my findings called, "London to Glastonbury." I had a very successful show when I returned back home. It drew attention from the viewers and local media towards the beauty of what I had captured in my pieces. That experience awakened a fire within me (a Greek fire) and I thought, "What if I painted the beauty in this world, moments that some people may never otherwise see in their lifetime? What if I inspired some of those people to go to these places themselves in order to understand and embrace different cultures?" 

I know studying abroad and painting Greece will have an even bigger impact! With opportunities to exhibit both in Greece at HISA and back in America, this is a wonderful chance to support the arts and help spread the beauty that is still left in this world. Art provides strength, courage, hope, and passion to see and embrace the world differently. Behind each and every painting there is a journey and a story. If learning the Greek language and it's culture has taught me anything so far, it's this: they accept everyone, we are all one people, and we should support one another. Support the arts and support the journey!

Risks & Challenges

I have had many obstacles in all of my attempts towards studying abroad in Greece. I have experienced a lack of support from close friends and family, challengers who try to sway me towards another path, and denied grant applications to study abroad for emerging artists. Most people would give up by now, but I have been through even more difficult challenges before and have made it through. The death of my 14-year-old brother always reminds me to keep reaching for my goal. In life, him and I were similar in that we believed we could overcome anything we set our mind to. Many of the things I do now, I do with him in my heart and mind! He would never give up and neither will I because I know that I am meant to do this!

Despite the obstacles, here I still stand, with the same passion and yearning to paint Greece. I will get there, one way or another, whether it be through a study abroad program or by planning my own solo trip. My vision is too clear for it not to come true and I cannot wait to share what I see with the world. Life is too short to sit idly by, so I embrace the obstacles as part of this journey to painting Greece!

Other Ways You Can Help

I sincerely appreciate any help that I can get! If you are unable to make a donation but are interested in supporting this campaign, please consider sharing this page! It would mean the world to me. Spread the word and support the arts!

Life is too short to sit idly by, so I embrace the obstacles as part of this journey to painting Greece!
    Other Ways You Can Help I sincerely appreciate any help that I can get! If you are unable to make a donation but are interested in supporting this campaign, please consider sharing this page! It would mean the world to me. Spread the word and support the arts!

story:
Who are we?

Created by three art students, Lucid Dream is a non-profit art collective that brings together a vast selection of creative minds.

What Do We Do?

Lucid Dream bridges the gap between the ‘ambitious but intimidated’ artist and Toronto’s thriving art community, by providing a safe space to connect and create.  

Where/When

Sat.July.9th

Super Wonder Gallery

876 Bloor St W, Toronto

8:00pm - 2:00am

Why ?

As young and ambitious artists, our desire to succeed is often shadowed by the intimidating feeling of pursuing a creative career. Unfortunately, most artists identify with this daunting feeling, and the lack of support from a creative community leaves us feeling even more discouraged, ultimately impeding our path to success.

How do we solve this?

Through transforming a space with ambient music, projection art, & good vibes, Lucid Dream provides a platform to create, connect, & collaborate with emerging artists. Interactive visuals and performances, ambient sounds, and genuine, down-to-earth individuals make up this surreal art experience that contributes to nurturing Toronto’s creative community. We sincerely invite you to connect and create with Toronto’s new generation of creative, ambitious, and passionate individuals.

You

To make this event possible, we need your help!

We have a budget of  $8500 which covers our venue, light & sound equipment, security, DJ, operational costs, art installation equipment, and artist compensation.


We hope to raise $2500 through the support from our friends and family. This will help cover:

  • our venue
     the Super Wonder Gallery is a large space that holds 300 guests // $2000

  • light & sound
    goes towards speakers, projectors, microphones, DJ) // $500+

Risk

We need $2500 to afford our venue’s deposit as well as be able to get the necessary light and sound equipment prior to the show.  If unable to achieve our goal, we are very unlikely to obtain the space and equipment that is vital to putting on this show. We sincerely ask for your support.

What you get?

IN THE CLOUDS: Min $100

  • Your name featured on our Large Lucid Dreams Poster

  • Shouted out on our social media platforms

  • Receive Two Drink Tickets

  • Receive Two Free Admission to this year’s Lucid Dream event.

  • Your name added to the public Go Fund Me Thank You List.

  • Your name displayed on live projection throughout the night!


FLYING: Min $50

  • Shouted out on our social media platforms

  • Receive One Drink Ticket

  • Receive Free Admission to this year’s Lucid Dream event

  • Your name added to the public Go Fund Me Thank You List

  • Your name displayed on live projection throughout the night!


FLOATING: min $35

  • Receive free admission to this year’s Lucid Dream event.

  • Your name added to the public Go Fund Me Thank You List.

  • Your name displayed on live projection throughout the night!


GROUND: min $15

  • To show our appreciation, your name will be added to our public Go Fund Me Thank You List!

----


We're looking to raise $2500(CAD), however, if you don't have the money to spare, you can still help us spread the word by sharing this campaign using social media, indiegogo sharing tools, word of mouth anything helps to make the dream work.

Thank you for all your support!

We sincerely invite you to connect and create with Toronto’s new generation of ambitious, passionate individuals...until then, sweet dreams.

story:
The Stuff of Growth

Forest of Imagination is all about celebrating creativity and making contemporary art accessible and engaging for the whole community. We believe that creativity enhances wellbeing and can transform lives, communities and cities. Forest of Imagination demonstrates the power of collaboration between creative industries, businesses, education, families and communities, spanning all age groups and united by one fact – that we are all artists.  

  • We are passionate about creativity’s essential role in education, as well as the immense potential in unexpected partnerships 
  • Forest of Imagination is an inspiring way to demonstrate what a child-friendly city looks and feels like, as well as highlighting the importance of reconnecting with nature in the urban environment
  • Directly impact the creative opportunities for children and adults to work alongside each other through enquiry-based learning  

What We Need & What You Get

  • We aim to raise an additional £10,000
  • Donations are paid directly into 5x5x5=creativity's charity account, which is audited and those funds will be solely used for the Forest of Imagination event, specifically for artist workshops
  • We have a range of rewards from limited edition prints by artists and illustrators, as well as event t-shirts and special editions 
  • Unlike other crowdfunding sites, we can still use any funds we achieve for our artists involvement in the event even if we do not reach our entire goal  

The Impact

We expect to improve on all aspects of last year’s event which achieved the following:

  • Attracted 7,684 participants of all ages (mainly from Bath) – audience numbers were nearly 4 times that of the 2014 event
  • Contemporary arts installations, interventions, workshops and performances in a city-centre location
  • Creative engagement with people of all ages through interactive installations and workshop programme
  • Over 30 local and international artists, designers, architects and landscape architects involved in the event
  • 15 all-day, free, open to all ages workshops
  • 7 half-day, free, open to all ages workshops
  • 2 in-depth talks – Human Nature and Everyone is an Artist – about the creative process of Forest from creative professionals and businesses involved with the event
  • Schools’ day – 7 local schools visited and took part in workshops and over 200 schoolchildren visited the Forest, supporting and championing creativity within their curriculum
  • 76 volunteers took part in our volunteer opportunities, donating a total of 3452 hours of their time 

Challenges

Fundraising is an ever increasing challenge, however we are committed to delivering an inspiring free event for all ages.  

  • We have successfully raised funds for the last 2 events. These funds come from a mixture of businesses, educational organisations, family trusts and individuals just like you who want to help us make a difference
  • We already have a number of wonderful sponsors for this year’s event, however due to a couple of unsuccessful funding applications, we need to make up the shortfall. By showing how successful Forest of Imagination has been in previous years and sharing the vision for this year we are confident that we can galvanise support and deliver an event without making any cuts to the programme
  • By offering a radical and unforgettable experience for all, along with tangible rewards that celebrate creativity we believe that achieving our funding target is possible

Other Ways to Support

Even if you can't contribute financially, there are other valuable ways we’d love you to be involved:

  • Please help us spread the word out and make some noise about Forest of Imagination
  • Come to the event on 3–6 June 2016 and celebrate creativity, work and play alongside artists, make new friends, be inspired by talks and find out what you can do for the environment
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and of course our social media channels

story:
The INVISIBLE HAND voted "Play of the Year" in Theater Heute...

 

My name is Joanna Godwin-Seidl, I am the director and producer of vienna theatre project. Our team needs your contributions to put on this and other shows.

www.viennatheatreproject.com was founded in 2002 to facilitate high-quality English-language theatre productions at different venues in and around Vienna. We want to illimunate the issues of our time and create an on-going dialogue between us and our audiences to open their minds to knew ideas and knowledge. Being a private, non profit company we are reliant on private funding for support. With this show we will donate some of our earnings to an NGO.

  • "The Invisible Hand" by Ayad Akhtar  Is a brilliant, sometimes humorous play about terrorism and the world of high finance,
  • What's the buzz? The protagonist Nick Bright, an investment banker for Citibank, has been kidnapped in Pakistan, by a group of would be terrorist, but with no one willing to pay his ransom of 10 milion dollars, he must find his own way out of his predicament. He is an investment banker, what would you do? A play about false alliances, confused ideals and packed with irony.
  • This play and it's story is too brilliant to put down. Its initial production, a European premiere in 2016,  enabled us to bring the discussion of terrorism and its roots to national radio, the press and  talk back sessions with NGOs, held with our audience. It's about morals, needs, politics and finance. An edge of your seat, gripping thriller!  It is a play about the irony of being in the wrong place at the wrong time that can set off a chain events of global significance, that we must be careful with the choices we make.  Put together in a great package with top actors!

This is what the papers said about the show so far:

".... in a confined space backed by the sound of drones and scorching heat, the four actors impress with realistic imagery."  Der Standard Feb. 2016

"Not just a tense hostage drama, but a crash course in financial trading...fascinating" FM4 Radio, February 2016

“..complex piece, with a great cast, who were compelling in the confined space.” Falter-Kultur, Also naming the show theatre tip of the week!

“The Invisible Hand has layers of delicious irony.” The Guardian, New York

Find our more about the actors below!

Another look at the show and actors here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BwYNg6dLi_8

What your sponsorship can achieve:

  • If you support us, you help us bring the knowledge and dialogue about terrorism to an even wider audience.  We feel very passionately that this discussion needs to be held.
  • See below for special deals, lovely goodies and advertising opportunities which you can receive/be part of.
  • Also very simply...you'll be supporting a fantastic play. We receive no state funding for the  production, which means all our finances are dependent on individual contributors and ticket sales. Be an individual contributor today!  
  • We will donate 10% of any earnings to the NGO Women Without Borders, who are currently working on an amazing programme to help parents prevent their children from becoming radicalised SAVE. http://www.women-without-borders.org/save/ they have already travelled to Pakistan, Belgium and more holding meetings there and in Vienna for this programme.
  • Please help us make a worthwhile contribution through theatre.

Here is the team of actors and the director:

We are very lucky to work with very briliant, award-winning/nominated, international actors on this show. Here is the team in brief. For more info on each actor feel free to visit our website.

Dave MOSKIN, plays investment banker NICK BRIGHT , born in New Jersey he started off as a child stage and film actor in the US. Most recently in Austria he starred in CHICKEN SHIT, Vienna’s English Theatre, DISGRACED, Theater Drachengasse, as well as starring in musicals such as HAIR Raimund Theater and the films WEISSEN RÖSSL and GOOD MORNING KABUL. He is the Producer of, and plays “Jake” in, The Blues Brothers Are Back, touring Europe. Film credits include Tootsie, The Godfather, Manhattan, Im Weissen Rössl (2013) and Good Morning Kabul (2015).

Michael SMULIK, plays BASHIR a British born terrorist,  was born in South Africa. He is now much  a sought after actor who also directs and writes. In Austria he won the national theatre Nestroy Award for best Newcomer. He has starred in award winning plays such as MEIN KAMPF, HABE DIE EHRE has also been in critically acclaimed TV series such as SCHLAWINER.  In 2001 he formed  his own band Christian&Michael und die Emotionale Rock-+Showband.

David WURAWA, plays IMAM SALEEM a leader in his Pakistani community: Began his professional acting training/ tutelage with tutors from Neighborhood School of Theater (USA), Act UP (UK), The Actors Centre (UK), London Academy of Media, Film & Television (UK). He starred and Co- produced NEW ORDER a Sci-fiction feature film starring the legendary Franco Nero. David has an extensive and international body of work in Film, Television, Radio and Theatre. Most recently he was seen in the multi-award winning film AUSSTIEG RECHTS, the hit play/film LA PASADA and the new made for TV, start up series pilot WIENERLAND, he also recently featured in the SOKO crime series in Germany, the film GARTEN AFRIKA and is currently starring in the stage version of BRAUNSCHLAG. www.davidwurawa.com

HISHAM ABBES MOUHIT plays young DAR a farmer boy from somewhere in Pakistan. At 15, he went alone to Vienna to train for drama, dance and singing at the conservatory „Sunrise studios“, Vienna.  Even during his education Hisham collected experience in theatre and film. Among others  BOYS DON’T CRY,  BOYS ARE BACK IN TOWN and  BOYS AWAKENING  in DSCHUNGEL Wien. He also had guest performances in Stadttheater Leoben, Landestheater Linz, City Theatre Helsingborg (Sweden) and Varaždin (Croatia). HAUNTED HOUSE, a romantic musical in Theater Die Neue Tribüne,  FUNNY GIRLS REVUE in Volkstheater, Rote Bar. Next he worked in concert performances with Drew Sarich (Silent Symphony) and Eva Maria Marold (Seebühne St. Pölten). In the spring of 2016, he released his first single "Unter Die Haut".

JOANNA GODWIN-SEIDL, director and producer, studied theatre in the UK. She has been running vienna theatre project since 2006. Credits as an actress include: 4:48 PSYCHOSIS, Sarah Kane, Dialogue im Dunkeln, HOW THE OTHER HALF LIVES, Kammeroper. Her big passion is directing. Musicals include THE LAST FIVE YEARS, Theater Drachengasse, TICK, TICK...BOOM, Theater Drachengasse. Plays she has directed and produced are, THE MEETING, Ensemble Theater, TOPDOG/UNDERDOG Theater Drachengasse and CLOSER, OFF Theater amongst many others. www.joannagodwinseidl.com

Check out pictures of this and other shows on www.flickr.com/viennatheatreproject

What We Need & What You Get

Here's a break down in more detail of how your help will help:

  • We need at least 10,000.-- Euro to get this show on stage. This money will go to the following: Performance rights, actors fees, set storage, props, costumes, posters and flyers, paying for PR, premiere food. vienna theatre project is a non-profit organisation all the money we make in our shows is invested into those shows with a very low profit margin, if any. The ticket prices charged are regulated and kept low Off Broadway Vienna to make theatre accessible to all.  IF there is any surplus that money is invested into the start up of the next production. In this case also some money will be donated to an anti-terrorism charity. Check out what our history is on www.viennatheatreproject.com

What's in it for you?

  • Private sponsors:

* Dependent on how much you donate:

signed programmes from the cast, a special mention in the programme, tickets to the show,  signed posters and flyers, a meet and greet with the cast, invite to a talkback session and a special evening just for you with cast and director where we cook for you or take you to dinner and discuss the play. You will be a supporter of the arts, and a valuable contributor to our company. You will enable a refugee to come and see the play for free. Those abroad a special video message from the cast. A skype with the cast.

  • Business Sponsors (dependent on level of sponsorship
    • A logo on our programme and on the on-line flyer and poster. Distribution throughout social media on Facebook (various different sites over 20k subscribers - as well as 3k subscribers on 2 vienna theatre project and a personal account) Twitter # over various media sites. Further uploading of the flyer and poster to over 20 recognised social media event sites and theatre pages.
    • A mention in our press release ( Austrian Press Agency release -reaches 600 press locations nationally and a 20k newsletter outreach. Own release reaches 20 specified newspapers)
    • As above signed programmes from the cast, a special mention in the programme, tickets to the show,  signed posters and flyers, a meet and greet with the cast, invite to a talkback session and a special evening just for you with cast and director where we cook for you or take you to dinner and discuss the play. You will enable a refugee to come and see the play for free. Those abroad a special video message from the cast. A skype with the cast. You will contribute and help advertise the SAVE (Sisters Against Violent Terrorism) pgroamme. You will be a supporter of the arts, and a valuable contributor to our company.
  • IF we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will go towards the actors fees and performance rights.

The Impact

  • The response we have already had to this and previous shows has been immense. It was so positive that many people and the theatre asked us to do it again, to continue the dialogue. We want to stage more talk back sessions, take the show elsewhere in Austria and Germany and show our audiences important issues that can be expressed via entertainment. You can listen to some of our radio interviews see more of the play here: www.youtube.com/viennatheatreproject
  • All of our projects have seen a 90% to 100% audience turn out with super feedback from them and the press, The theatre is small but we have a wide outreach and want to continue talking about the things that make us get up mornings. Things we are passionate about and feel need to be out in the open and not hidden from. Our most humbling moment was when a muslim school came to see a previous show about Islamophobia and we had the most amazing discussions with these brilliant young people.
  • We are a small company that want to make a difference in a positive manner, we have no funds but pursue each project with a level of professionality and perservierance that enables us to get the job done. See some of the feedback we get from the press by visiting http://www.viennatheatreproject.com/#!press/c14ak or follow us anytime you like on www.facebook.com/viennatheatreproject
  • We look forward to supporting and highlighting a good cause with the SAVE programme.

Risks & Challenges

  • The risks are we make no money at the box office and are unable to pay the actors. That is very serious.  
  • Not making the amount of money we need in time
  • Being able to secure enough interest in the production re-run in Vienna
  • Most astonishingly the newest risks....we were recently recommended to stop doing the plays as they are too dangerous in the current climate, even the press two years ago asked if we were not concerned. This is our response, if we stop the discussion we halt progress. Our shows  point no fingers, criticise no one, just open up a discourse on whatever subject matter  we deal with and make people think. We invite everyone to come and enjoy this wonderful experience with us and keep the discussion going.
  • What else are we doing? We are further applying to various companies and embassies in the hope they might be interested in supporting us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Maybe you cannot contribute financially, but you can help! Please send this fund request out to the world;  copy it to friends, colleagues, family. That would mean so much to everyone involved in this project.
  • Share us/like us on www.facebook.com/viennatheatreproject
  • Share us on www.twitter.com/viennatheatreP
  • Share our website www.viennatheatreproject.com
  • Share our poster 
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools! Every bit helps.

Among others  BOYS DON’T CRY,  BOYS ARE BACK IN TOWN and  BOYS AWAKENING  in DSCHUNGEL Wien. He also had guest performances in Stadttheater Leoben, Landestheater Linz, City Theatre Helsingborg (Sweden) and Varaždin (Croatia). HAUNTED HOUSE, a romantic musical in Theater Die Neue Tribüne,  FUNNY GIRLS REVUE in Volkstheater, Rote Bar. Next he worked in concert performances with Drew Sarich (Silent Symphony) and Eva Maria Marold (Seebühne St. Pölten). In the spring of 2016, he released his first single "Unter Die Haut".
JOANNA GODWIN-SEIDL, director and producer, studied theatre in the UK. She has been running vienna theatre project since 2006. Credits as an actress include: 4:48 PSYCHOSIS, Sarah Kane, Dialogue im Dunkeln, HOW THE OTHER HALF LIVES, Kammeroper. Her big passion is directing. Musicals include THE LAST FIVE YEARS, Theater Drachengasse, TICK, TICK...BOOM, Theater Drachengasse. Plays she has directed and produced are, THE MEETING, Ensemble Theater, TOPDOG/UNDERDOG Theater Drachengasse and CLOSER, OFF Theater amongst many others. www.joannagodwinseidl.com
Check out pictures of this and other shows on www.flickr.com/viennatheatreproject

What We Need & What You Get
Here's a break down in more detail of how your help will help:
We need at least 10,000.-- Euro to get this show on stage. This money will go to the following: Performance rights, actors fees, set storage, props, costumes, posters and flyers, paying for PR, premiere food. vienna theatre project is a non-profit organisation all the money we make in our shows is invested into those shows with a very low profit margin, if any. The ticket prices charged are regulated and kept low Off Broadway Vienna to make theatre accessible to all.  IF there is any surplus that money is invested into the start up of the next production. In this case also some money will be donated to an anti-terrorism charity. Check out what our history is on www.viennatheatreproject.com

What's in it for you? 
Private sponsors:
* Dependent on how much you donate:
signed programmes from the cast, a special mention in the programme, tickets to the show,  signed posters and flyers, a meet and greet with the cast, invite to a talkback session and a special evening just for you with cast and director where we cook for you or take you to dinner and discuss the play. You will be a supporter of the arts, and a valuable contributor to our company. You will enable a refugee to come and see the play for free. Those abroad a special video message from the cast. A skype with the cast.

Business Sponsors (dependent on level of sponsorship
A logo on our programme and on the on-line flyer and poster. Distribution throughout social media on Facebook (various different sites over 20k subscribers - as well as 3k subscribers on 2 vienna theatre project and a personal account) Twitter # over various media sites. Further uploading of the flyer and poster to over 20 recognised social media event sites and theatre pages.
A mention in our press release ( Austrian Press Agency release -reaches 600 press locations nationally and a 20k newsletter outreach. Own release reaches 20 specified newspapers)
As above signed programmes from the cast, a special mention in the programme, tickets to the show,  signed posters and flyers, a meet and greet with the cast, invite to a talkback session and a special evening just for you with cast and director where we cook for you or take you to dinner and discuss the play. You will enable a refugee to come and see the play for free. Those abroad a special video message from the cast. A skype with the cast. You will contribute and help advertise the SAVE (Sisters Against Violent Terrorism) pgroamme. You will be a supporter of the arts, and a valuable contributor to our company.


IF we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will go towards the actors fees and performance rights.


The Impact


The response we have already had to this and previous shows has been immense. It was so positive that many people and the theatre asked us to do it again, to continue the dialogue. We want to stage more talk back sessions, take the show elsewhere in Austria and Germany and show our audiences important issues that can be expressed via entertainment. You can listen to some of our radio interviews see more of the play here: www.youtube.com/viennatheatreproject

All of our projects have seen a 90% to 100% audience turn out with super feedback from them and the press, The theatre is small but we have a wide outreach and want to continue talking about the things that make us get up mornings. Things we are passionate about and feel need to be out in the open and not hidden from. Our most humbling moment was when a muslim school came to see a previous show about Islamophobia and we had the most amazing discussions with these brilliant young people.
We are a small company that want to make a difference in a positive manner, we have no funds but pursue each project with a level of professionality and perservierance that enables us to get the job done. See some of the feedback we get from the press by visiting http://www.viennatheatreproject.com/#!press/c14ak or follow us anytime you like on www.facebook.com/viennatheatreproject

We look forward to supporting and highlighting a good cause with the SAVE programme.


Risks & Challenges

The risks are we make no money at the box office and are unable to pay the actors. That is very serious.  
Not making the amount of money we need in time
Being able to secure enough interest in the production re-run in Vienna
Most astonishingly the newest risks....we were recently recommended to stop doing the plays as they are too dangerous in the current climate, even the press two years ago asked if we were not concerned. This is our response, if we stop the discussion we halt progress. Our shows  point no fingers, criticise no one, just open up a discourse on whatever subject matter  we deal with and make people think. We invite everyone to come and enjoy this wonderful experience with us and keep the discussion going.
What else are we doing? We are further applying to various companies and embassies in the hope they might be interested in supporting us. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you cannot contribute financially, but you can help! Please send this fund request out to the world;  copy it to friends, colleagues, family. That would mean so much to everyone involved in this project.
Share us/like us on www.facebook.com/viennatheatreproject

Share us on www.twitter.com/viennatheatreP

Share our website www.viennatheatreproject.com

Share our poster 

You can use the Indiegogo share tools! Every bit helps.

story:
Cascadia Serapeum is a large scale art installation for Burning Man 2016. 

A Library, based on the Library of Alexandria, 38 feet in diameter and 16 feet high, with all the beauty of the Ancient Greeks, but with a contemporary twist that will challenge your preconceived judgements and expectations.


First, we would like to begin by THANKING ALL OF THE CONTRIBUTORS of our first campaign! With your help, we have been able to purchase building materials for shelving and structure, columns, and the central podium.


BUT NOW, WE NEED YOUR HELP SETTING IT ALL ON FIRE!!


Other events and efforts across all three cities have helped start off our build in a super exciting way! The central podium and book made their debut at SOAK*, Portland's Regional, and columns are ready to go for Critical, Seattle's Regional. Bookshelves are being built in Vancouver as we speak and this is 

ALL THANKS TO YOU!

                            

                                                                                                        

                          


                     
                                                   

     




With Cascadia Serpeum, we are hoping to challenge people's pre-learned ideas and perceptions. Things will not be as you expected, and there are many interesting surprises. On Thursday night of the Burn, the structure will go up in flames, leaving ruins behind. The podium and Community Book will remain in the centre, unscathed by the fire, reminding us that even in perceived destruction, beauty and community continue. Perceived "destruction" is challenged. Beauty and rebirth come from what may seem at one point to be an ending.


Have a look at our original indiegogo for more info about what we are doing! https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/cascadia-serapeum-a-project-for-burning-man-2016/x/663345#/
Fundraising efforts are continuing, and there is still lots to do. Things we are hoping to use this Part 2 campaign for include the lighting, propane for the flame effects, and DG for our burn in the desert (Thursday night at 11pm, btw) You all like FIRE, right???
Again, thank you all!! Please have a look at the perks we are offering in gratitude to you and your contributions. If you see anything that interests you, but you would like further information, please contact us through our website at www.cascadiaserapeum.com.

________________________________
Pics of Perks

story:
HOW TO DONATE:
  1. Click on the pink button to your right "Contribute now"
  2. Choose if you want a perk and which one. Otherwise decide only the amount to donate
  3. Login through Facebook or type your e-mail address.
  4. Click the "Continue to payment" button and choose if you want to pay with credit card or pay pal.

COME DONARE:
  1. Clicca sul pulsante rosa "Contribute now" alla tua destra
  2. Scegli il tuo omaggio (perk), altrimenti  semplicemente decidi la somma da donare
  3. Loggati con Facebook o inserisci la tua e-mail
  4. Clicca sul bottone "Continue to payment"  e scegli se vuoi pagare con carta di credito o pay pal.

Firenze Suona Contemporanea "Aprire Venere"

Founded in 2008 by composer Andrea Cavallari - with 25 years of experience on  experimental and contemporary music - and co-directed since 2013 by Luisa Valeria Carpignano - pianist, composer and curator. FIRENZE SUONA CONTEMPORANEA was the first festival of its kind in Italy that presented an international repertoire of solely contemporary music.
In 2013 the festival decided to duplicate efforts and introduce visual arts to its project with the unique collaboration of Maria Gloria Conti Bicocchi - art critic and historical founder of Art/Tapes/22.
FSC began its news challenge: to create   a multidisciplinary event that concentrates experimental contemporary music with visual arts.

Fondata nel 2008 dal compositore Andrea Cavallari -  25 anni di esperienza nella musica sperimentale e co-diretto dal 2013 da Luisa Valeria Carpignano - pianista, compositrice e curatrice. FIRENZE SUONA CONTEMPORANEA è stato il primo festival di questo tipo in Italia a presentare un repertorio internazionale specializzato in musica contemporanea.
Nel 2013 il festival ha deciso di raddoppiare gli sforzi introducendo al suo progetto le arti visive con la preziosa collaborazione di Maria Gloria Conti Bicocchi - critica di storia dell'arte e fondatrice di Art/Tapes/22.
FSC ha iniziato le sue nuove sfide: creare un evento multidisciplinare che concentri musica contemporanea e arti visive.

The last edition of our festival saw an incredible success with the performance, for the first time in Florence, of South African artist William Kentridge and composer Philip Miller.

L'ultima edizione del nostro festival ha visto un incredibile successo con la performance, per la prima volta a Firenza, dell'artista Sud Africano William Kentridge e del compositore Philip Miller.

FIRENZE SUONA CONTEMPORANEA has three main goals:
 

  • To preserve artistic inventiveness always on the highest levels

  • To engage emerging musicians, composers and artists.

  • To commission and to fund brand new productions that will debut in our Florentine festival.

FIRENZE SUONA CONTEMPORANEA ha tre principali obiettivi:
 

  • Preservare l'inventiva artistica al più alto livello

  • scovare musicisti, compositori ed artisti emergenti.

  • Commissionare e finanziare un brand di nuove produzioni che debutterà nel nostro Festival fiorentino.
Part of the 2015 program:

  • Philosopher and art historian Georges Didi-Huberman
  • Contemporary artist Jannis Kounellis with a specific on-site installation for Bargello Museum courtyard  that will be presented with a concert by Alter Ego Ensemble
  • Contemporary artist Alfredo Pirri will appropriate the cloister of the Novecento Museum to create an acoustic installation next to musician Alvin Curran.
  • Audio visual installation by IRCAM institute
  • And musicians: Kammeroper Frankfurt, the ensemble FLAME, the Nordic Voices, trio 7090, among others.
Parte del programma 2015:

  • il filosofo e storico dell'arte Georges Didi-Huberman
  • l'artista contemporaneo Jannis Kounellis con una sua installazione  specifica per il cortile interno del Museo del Bargello che sarà presentata con un concerto dell' Alter Ego Ensemble
  • l'artista contemporaneo Alfredo Pirri che si approprierà del chiostro del Museo Novecento per creare un installazione acustica insieme al musicista Alvin Curran.
  • un installazione audio visiva dell'istituto IRCAM
  • ed i musicisti: Kammeroper Frankfurt, l'ensemble FLAME, i Nordic Voices, trio 7090 e tanti altri.

    Contemporary means new, means fresh, means evolution!!

    What we need

    We are a NON-PROFIT organization, which means that all funding received goes straight to artists and musicians' fees, their productions as well as all expenses related to travel and lodging while visiting the festival. YOUR HELP will encourage the diffusion of contemporary culture among new generations.

    We need your donation to keep the festival alive!


    What You Get

    Each donation has a series of benefits like:

    • Complimentary tickets,

    • Name listed on our website among the festival patrons

    • YOUR Logo under "Our Network" page that redirects to your website.

    • DVD's and CD's

    • Posters signed by the artist

    Cosa Necessitiamo

    siamo un'organizzazione NON-PROFIT quindi tutti i  finanziamenti che riceviamo verranno interamente investiti negl' artisti e musicisti, nelle loro produzioni e nelle loro spese di alloggio durante il festival. IL TUO AIUTO servirà alla diffusione della cultura contemporanea fra le nuove generazioni.

    Abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto per mantere il festival in vita!


    Cosa Ricevi

    ogni donazione ti darà la possibilità di ricevere una serie di benefici:

    • Biglietti omaggio,

    • il tuo nome sul nostro sito internet nella pagina dedicata ai sostenitori

    • Il tuo logo sulla pagina "Our Network" che reindirizzerà al tuo sito.

    • DVD's and CD's

    • locandine autografate dall'artista

    Please share, share, and share!!!

    Per favore condividi, condividi, condividi!!!


    With the support of
