story:
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

 

 

 

///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////


//////// ENGLISH 
 

Michela Cinus 

 

I'm a Creative Art Director, Designer and Artist, based in Sardinia, Italy, in love with life and nature and sea-addicted. You can see more about me here: 

Website - Facebook - Instagram

 

The Installation

I want to create a massive scale art installation with fifty or more floating sea turtles.
The floating Turtles will be white and minimal representing the ghosts of turtles killed by human impact, back to remind us that may still be there and it is our duty to respect the environment.

WHERE

The first host will be Sardinia after which I would love to take it to any other island or location interested in this art project and in the conservation of Sea Turtles.

 

WHY I'M DOING THIS INSTALLATION - Four reasons:

 

1. Worldwide millions of sea turtles have been killed in the last 20 years due to: beach development, plastic refuse, poaching, long lines, nets, etc. Six of the seven sea turtle species are classified as endangered due to human actions and lifestyles.

 

2. I strongly believe that art is the best and most effective way to communicate vital messages.

 

3. Sea turtles are a fundamental link in marine ecosystems. They have vital roles in maintaining the health of the oceans.

 

4. The Sea Turtle has an important symbolic role, it is the symbol of wisdom, prudence, power, stability, regeneration of man and evolution. It is the image of the universe and contributes to its stability. In a broader sense this installation aims to remind us that, distracted by commitments and daily routines, we are slowly losing humanity’s most precious asset.

 

The Project

This installation is part of Sea Turtles from the Past, an art project that involves the creation and staging of various installations and art experiences, in some cases installed independently, others in collaboration with other artists. In Sea Turtles from the Past turtles who once lived in the Gulf of Cagliari, in our seas and oceans, killed due to human impact, return to remind us that they may still be there, and that we have to respect the environment if not turtles will disappear from Sardinia, the Mediterranean, from the planet.

 

Sea Turtles from the Past Project Facebook Page
Sea Turtles from the Past Project Instagram 

What I Need

 

I need $30,000 funding for the production of the floating turtles, setting up of the installation and related costs. 

I want to construct a minimum of 50 stylized floating turtle-ghosts (depending on funding amount). Dimensions of each turtle: 90x90 cm. Materials: eco leather outside and eco polystyrene or plastic waste interior.

You will see the results online - it will have big impact and I already have some media partners that will communicate my work to a wide audience. 
 

Donations

Please support the project with a donation. You will help sea turtles, oceans, and the planet earth, reminding the whole word that nature is our greatest treasure, our first teacher and we must respect it.    
HELP ME AND PUBLIC ART SPEAK FOR TURTLES!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Other ways you can help

You could also contribute: 

  • being a media partner
  • sharing this project with the Indiegogo share tools! Hashtag: #seaturtlesFDP
  • hosting the installation in your country; 

If You'd Like to Learn More about

The survival of the s­ea turtle
Why Healthy Oceans Need Sea Turtles
Scientist Spotlight - Wallace J Nichols - Sea Turtle Conservation
 
 

 

 

//////// ITALIANO

 

Sea Turtles from the Past
Installazione Galleggiante

Le tartarughe marine morte a causa dell'uomo tornano in mare tornano per ricordarci che potrebbero essere ancora li.
 

 

 

Michela Cinus 

Sono un'Art Director, Designer e Artista Sarda. Potete vedere altro riguardo me qui: 

Sito Web - Facebook - Instagram 

L'installazione

 

Voglio creare una installazione artistica su larga scala con 50 o più tartarughe marine galleggianti. Queste saranno bianche e minimali, a simboleggiare i fantasmi delle tartarughe marine uccise dall'impatto umano e tornate per ricordarci che potrebbero essere ancora li e che abbiamo il dovere di rispettare l'ambiente. 

Prima location ad ospitarla sarà la Sardegna e successivamente vorrei mostrarla in altre isole ed altre location interessate a questo progetto artistico e alla tutela e conservazione delle tartarughe marine. 

Perché sto creando questa installazione? Per 4 motivi:

1. Sono Sarda, e anni fa numerose tartarughe marine vivevano attorno alla Sardegna ma ora solo poche di esse sono rimaste e in tutto il mondo negli ultimi 20 anni, milioni di tartarughe marine sono morte a causa di: abusi edilizi vicino alle spiagge, rifiuti di plastica, bracconaggio, reti da pesca invasive, ecc. Sei delle sette specie di tartarughe marine sono state classificate come in via di estinzione a causa delle azioni dell’uomo e del suo stile di vita.

2. Sono fermamente convinta che l'arte sia il modo migliore e più efficace per comunicare messaggi vitali.

3. Le tartarughe marine sono un anello fondamentale negli ecosistemi marini.

4. la tartaruga ha un importante ruolo simbolico, è simbolo della saggezza, prudenza, forza, stabilità, rigenerazione dell'uomo ed evoluzione. È immagine dell'universo e contribuisce alla sua stabilità.

Il Progetto

Questa installazione è parte dell'omonimo progetto Sea Turtles from the Past, progetto artistico che prevede la creazione di varie installazioni ed esperienze artistiche, in alcuni casi realizzate in autonomia, in altri in collaborazione con altri artisti. In Sea Turtles from the Past le tartarughe marine che un tempo vivevano nel Golfo di Cagliari, In Sardegna, nei nostri mari ed oceani, morte a causa dell'uomo, tornano per ricordarci che potrebbero essere ancora li, e che se abbiamo il dovere di rispettare l'ambiente; se non lo faremo scompariranno dalla Sardegna, dal Mediterraneo e dall'intero Pianeta. 

Pagina Facebook Sea Turtles from the Past Project
Instagram Sea Turtles from the Past Project
 

Che cosa mi occorre

 

Mi occorrono $30,000 ( €26,000 ) per la produzione delle tartarughe galleggianti, l'installazione delle stesse ed i costi connessi. 

Voglio costruire 50 o più tartarughe marine fantasma, galleggianti, stilizzate. Dimensioni di ogni tartaruga: 90x90 cm. Materiali: eco pelle nautica per l'esterno ed eco polistirene o rifiuti di plastica per l'interno.

Vedrete il risultato on line - avrà in grande impatto ed ho già alcuni Media Partner che comunicheranno il mio lavoro ad un vasto pubblico.

Donazioni

Puoi unirti a me sostenendo il progetto con una donazione e condividendo questa campagna sui social network.
Entrando a far parte del progetto aiuterai le tartarughe marine, gli oceani, e l’intero pianeta ricordando in tutto il mondo che la natura è il nostro più grande tesoro, il nostro primo maestro e dobbiamo sempre rispettarla.
AIUTA ME E L’ARTE PUBBLICA A PARLARE IN NOME DELLE TARTARUGHE MARINE!

 

 

Altri modi per contribuire

Puoi contribuire anche: 

  • diventando media partner;
  • condividendo questa campagna con gli strumenti di condivisione di Indiegogo Hashtag: #seaturtlesFDP
  • ospitando l'installazione nel tuo paese

 

 

Approfondimenti sul tema

Tutti gli sponsor, i partner, le aziende, i professionisti  e gli amici che fino ad ora hanno mostrato interesse e disponibilità verso il progetto, lo hanno supportato o hanno mostrato la volontà di supportarlo in futuro: Tiscali, Tartalife, Doc Servizi, MagLab, LMDP Festival Internazionale di Teatro Arte e Nuove Tecnologie, Kyberteatro, Rendering Studio, Open Campus, Incas Pisano Nautica, Motomar Sarda, Nausdream, IED, Radio X, Poli System, Sjmtech, Cristiana Cappagli, Carlo Leone, Kate Jenkins, Géraldine Dups, Flavio Sacco, Massimo Deriu, Michele Ledda, Monica Satta, Gianfranco Liori, Marcello Melis, Valeria Boi, Francesca Mereu, Daniele Pagella, Romeo Scaccia, Lucia Dessì, Richard Pettifer e tutti voi.

story_txt:
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 
 
 

///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
//////// ENGLISH  
Michela Cinus 
 
I'm a Creative Art Director, Designer and Artist, based in Sardinia, Italy, in love with life and nature and sea-addicted. You can see more about me here: 
Website - Facebook - Instagram
 
The Installation
I want to create a massive scale art installation with fifty or more floating sea turtles.The floating Turtles will be white and minimal representing the ghosts of turtles killed by human impact, back to remind us that may still be there and it is our duty to respect the environment.
WHERE
The first host will be Sardinia after which I would love to take it to any other island or location interested in this art project and in the conservation of Sea Turtles.
 
WHY I'M DOING THIS INSTALLATION - Four reasons:
 
1. Worldwide millions of sea turtles have been killed in the last 20 years due to: beach development, plastic refuse, poaching, long lines, nets, etc. Six of the seven sea turtle species are classified as endangered due to human actions and lifestyles.
 
2. I strongly believe that art is the best and most effective way to communicate vital messages. 
 
3. Sea turtles are a fundamental link in marine ecosystems. They have vital roles in maintaining the health of the oceans.
 
4. The Sea Turtle has an important symbolic role, it is the symbol of wisdom, prudence, power, stability, regeneration of man and evolution. It is the image of the universe and contributes to its stability. In a broader sense this installation aims to remind us that, distracted by commitments and daily routines, we are slowly losing humanity’s most precious asset.
 
The Project
This installation is part of Sea Turtles from the Past, an art project that involves the creation and staging of various installations and art experiences, in some cases installed independently, others in collaboration with other artists. In Sea Turtles from the Past turtles who once lived in the Gulf of Cagliari, in our seas and oceans, killed due to human impact, return to remind us that they may still be there, and that we have to respect the environment if not turtles will disappear from Sardinia, the Mediterranean, from the planet.
  Sea Turtles from the Past Project Facebook PageSea Turtles from the Past Project Instagram 

What I Need

 
I need $30,000 funding for the production of the floating turtles, setting up of the installation and related costs. 
I want to construct a minimum of 50 stylized floating turtle-ghosts (depending on funding amount). Dimensions of each turtle: 90x90 cm. Materials: eco leather outside and eco polystyrene or plastic waste interior.
You will see the results online - it will have big impact and I already have some media partners that will communicate my work to a wide audience.  
Donations
Please support the project with a donation. You will help sea turtles, oceans, and the planet earth, reminding the whole word that nature is our greatest treasure, our first teacher and we must respect it.    HELP ME AND PUBLIC ART SPEAK FOR TURTLES!
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

Other ways you can help
You could also contribute: 

being a media partner
sharing this project with the Indiegogo share tools! Hashtag: #seaturtlesFDP
hosting the installation in your country; 

If You'd Like to Learn More about
The survival of the s­ea turtleWhy Healthy Oceans Need Sea TurtlesScientist Spotlight - Wallace J Nichols - Sea Turtle Conservation   
 
//////// ITALIANO Sea Turtles from the PastInstallazione Galleggiante

Le tartarughe marine morte a causa dell'uomo tornano in mare tornano per ricordarci che potrebbero essere ancora li. 

 
 
Michela Cinus 
Sono un'Art Director, Designer e Artista Sarda. Potete vedere altro riguardo me qui: 
Sito Web - Facebook - Instagram 
L'installazione
 
Voglio creare una installazione artistica su larga scala con 50 o più tartarughe marine galleggianti. Queste saranno bianche e minimali, a simboleggiare i fantasmi delle tartarughe marine uccise dall'impatto umano e tornate per ricordarci che potrebbero essere ancora li e che abbiamo il dovere di rispettare l'ambiente. 
Prima location ad ospitarla sarà la Sardegna e successivamente vorrei mostrarla in altre isole ed altre location interessate a questo progetto artistico e alla tutela e conservazione delle tartarughe marine. 
Perché sto creando questa installazione? Per 4 motivi:
1. Sono Sarda, e anni fa numerose tartarughe marine vivevano attorno alla Sardegna ma ora solo poche di esse sono rimaste e in tutto il mondo negli ultimi 20 anni, milioni di tartarughe marine sono morte a causa di: abusi edilizi vicino alle spiagge, rifiuti di plastica, bracconaggio, reti da pesca invasive, ecc. Sei delle sette specie di tartarughe marine sono state classificate come in via di estinzione a causa delle azioni dell’uomo e del suo stile di vita.
2. Sono fermamente convinta che l'arte sia il modo migliore e più efficace per comunicare messaggi vitali.
3. Le tartarughe marine sono un anello fondamentale negli ecosistemi marini.
4. la tartaruga ha un importante ruolo simbolico, è simbolo della saggezza, prudenza, forza, stabilità, rigenerazione dell'uomo ed evoluzione. È immagine dell'universo e contribuisce alla sua stabilità.
Il Progetto
Questa installazione è parte dell'omonimo progetto Sea Turtles from the Past, progetto artistico che prevede la creazione di varie installazioni ed esperienze artistiche, in alcuni casi realizzate in autonomia, in altri in collaborazione con altri artisti. In Sea Turtles from the Past le tartarughe marine che un tempo vivevano nel Golfo di Cagliari, In Sardegna, nei nostri mari ed oceani, morte a causa dell'uomo, tornano per ricordarci che potrebbero essere ancora li, e che se abbiamo il dovere di rispettare l'ambiente; se non lo faremo scompariranno dalla Sardegna, dal Mediterraneo e dall'intero Pianeta. 
Pagina Facebook Sea Turtles from the Past ProjectInstagram Sea Turtles from the Past Project  Che cosa mi occorre
 
Mi occorrono $30,000 ( €26,000 ) per la produzione delle tartarughe galleggianti, l'installazione delle stesse ed i costi connessi. 
Voglio costruire 50 o più tartarughe marine fantasma, galleggianti, stilizzate. Dimensioni di ogni tartaruga: 90x90 cm. Materiali: eco pelle nautica per l'esterno ed eco polistirene o rifiuti di plastica per l'interno.
Vedrete il risultato on line - avrà in grande impatto ed ho già alcuni Media Partner che comunicheranno il mio lavoro ad un vasto pubblico.
Donazioni
Puoi unirti a me sostenendo il progetto con una donazione e condividendo questa campagna sui social network.Entrando a far parte del progetto aiuterai le tartarughe marine, gli oceani, e l’intero pianeta ricordando in tutto il mondo che la natura è il nostro più grande tesoro, il nostro primo maestro e dobbiamo sempre rispettarla.AIUTA ME E L’ARTE PUBBLICA A PARLARE IN NOME DELLE TARTARUGHE MARINE!
 
 Altri modi per contribuire
Puoi contribuire anche: 

diventando media partner;
condividendo questa campagna con gli strumenti di condivisione di Indiegogo Hashtag: #seaturtlesFDP
ospitando l'installazione nel tuo paese

story:
My name is Kanenhariyo. I am a Kanyenkehaka (Mohawk) man from the Tehanakarineh family of the Bear Clan. My home is in Tyendinaga Mohawk Territory, but I currently reside at the Six Nations of the Grand River Territory (near Hamilton, Ontario). I am an Onkwehon:we (indigenous) man and I belong to the Kayenkehaka Nation, not the Canadian or English nation. My people have kept our ways and traditions, and despite generations of mistreatment at the hands of the Canadian government, we remain a separate, allied Nation with our own rights and responsibilities to creation.

I am asking you for your support in an important issue affecting me and my people. As you may be aware, the Conservative Federal Government of Stephen Harper has been mounting a concerted campaign to roll back and terminate our rights as indigenous peoples. In addition to the omnibus bills that sparked the Idle No More movement, the Harper government has also being targeting our people with malicious bills like the “anti-contraband Tobacco” Bill C-10 that target the lifeblood of our economy.

The Federal Government’s attempt to stop indigenous people from growing and manufacturing tobacco stem from their interests in keeping our communities poor and subservient. Our communities have been faced with an economic blockade, as government officials try and stop us from engaging in trade and commerce on our own terms and send our people to jail in ever increasing numbers for trading goods we have traded on these lands for thousands of years.

In all the time I've been involved in the tobacco trade, I have always only done business with other indigenous people on our own territories. We have been using this plant gifted us from the creator – one which our ancestors grew and traded with long before any white person came to these shores – to rebuild our economy and gain a measure of self-suffiency. This economic independence scares the Canadian government, because it means that our political independence will not be long in following it.

On July 16th 2014, I was stopped by the police and charged for pulling a trailer of tobacco I grew at my home at Six Nations of the Grand River Territory and had manufactured into cigarettes in my home community of Tyendinaga. I am now facing a $629,000 fine and up to two years in jail for the “offence” of growing and manufacturing tobacco on my own land, according to my own ways and customs. My actions harmed no-one and were undertaken so that I could feed my family.

With my pre-trial beginning on July 30th, 2015, I will be bringing a constitutional challenge to court, and requesting that the Crown handle this matter through the treaty relationship protocol that exists between our peoples as allies – the Silver Covenant Chain. The Silver Covenant Chain is a protocol by which the Mohawk nation and the British Crown repeatedly affirmed our treaty relationship in the past, and was renewed by the Queen of England as recently as 2010 when the Queen presented Mohawk leaders with a set of eight silver bells engraved with the words “Silver Chain of Friendship 1710-2010” to commemorate the 300 year treaty alliance between our peoples.

According to this covenant, our people do not have any rights to place judgement on each other unless the matter concerns an act of theft, rape, murder or treason. To operate according to the Silver Covenant Chain means to respect our Two Row relationship of non-interference in each others affairs, and to use diplomatic means to “polish” any tarnishing of our relationship as allies by seeking a mutually beneficial resolution of any matters which might affect our friendship as peoples.

I am now organizing a defence campaign and fundraising drive to bring a powerful legal and political challenge to the agenda seeking to destroy indigenous rights in Canada. I want to use my case as a precedent to encourage the Canadian government to uphold its treaty relationship with my people on a nation to nation basis, and to bring awareness to ordinary Canadians about their rights and responsibilities that stem from the relationship between our peoples.

This constitutional and political campaign is going to cost money, and I am currently embarking on a massive fundraising campaign to raise $100,000 by July 30th 2015 when my pre-trial commences. I have also launched a podcast and multimedia website at www.wgopodcast.com to inform the people of “What’s going on?” with my case and other issues affecting our treaty rights.

I thank you for any contribution you are able to make in upholding our collective rights and responsibilities.

story:
Follies of God: Tennessee Williams and the Women of the Fog received funds from a previous Indiegogo campaign, and some of those who contributed are thanked in the book, which was published by Knopf this past March. My next book, Come Up A Man: The Hungers of Marlon Brando requires that I take a leave of one month to finalize research and the manuscript prior to publication. There is some travel involved, but, for the most part, these funds buy me the time to complete the book.

I began having telephone calls with Marlon Brando in June of 1990, and these calls, unexpected and always fairly late in the night, continued for two years. The book is not a biography so much as it is a journey in which Brando asked me to find out where peace could be found, and to ask others if they had found it.

The book contains interviews with Bette Davis, Katharine Hepburn, Agnes de Mille, Martha Graham, Harold Pinter, Sidney Lumet, Marian Seldes, Arthur Penn, Maureen Stapleton, Uta Hagen, and many others.

The five traits Brando sent me to learn more about, and which he believed would lead him--and others--to peace were:

 

1.  Faith

2.  Will

3.  Control

4.  Love

5.  Acceptance


Come Up A Man: The Hungers of Marlon Brando reveals what Brando and others believed these traits to be, and how best they should be applied.
